commit_message:
Don't decide web_framework before config parse

This ensures that the config files passed on the CLI
are parsed before the choice is made based on config options
to launch pecan/homegrown wsgi handler.

Closes-Bug: #1537292
Change-Id: I577befea74d84d611cd198c92c54ae3651e2d921

commit_message:
Try vxlan instead of gre for overlays

It looks like some providers may not allow IP type 47 (GRE) traffic to
pass their networks. See if using vxlan is a useable workaround.

Change-Id: I951e7e1bd98eeaf347e85296c12e027e225c2c97

commit_message:
add a job to send automated announcements of releases

Define a new job {name}-announce-release to send announcements of new
releases and associate it with the "release" queue to be run after the
release is completed and uploaded to PyPI (for libraries) or the tarball
server (for server projects). We don't want pre-releases (alphas, betas,
and release candidates) to have announcements generated automatically.

The job uses a script in the openstack-infra/release-tools repository to
actually generate and send the email. This is part of the same set of
tools we've been using for manual release announcements.

Spec: release-automation
Story: 2000421
Change-Id: I8106f8449d6c41da6b799aee484e81ffebb498bf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Jeremy Stanley <fungi@yuggoth.org>

Refactor the current execute and revert functions
to be co-located with the work units that handle
making that work occur.

This makes it easier to identify what work unit
is scheduled (or to be scheduled) and makes it easier

Change-Id: I76c23497fe9a851e22d53c004e51b57d8eca9737
'}]
commit_message:
Create and use individual work units

Refactor the current execute and revert functions
to be co-located with the work units that handle
making that work occur.

This makes it easier to identify what work unit
is scheduled (or to be scheduled) and makes it easier
to identify what code will be finally called to execute
that work unit.

Change-Id: I76c23497fe9a851e22d53c004e51b57d8eca9737

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 8959, 'name': 'Lakshmi N Sampath', 'email': 'lakshmi.sampath@hp.com', 'username': 'lakshmi'}, {'_account_id': 12597, 'name': 'Lin Yang', 'email': 'lin.a.yang@intel.com', 'username': 'lin.yang'}, {'_account_id': 18675, 'name': 'Sharath Rao', 'email': 'sharath.rao@ericsson.com', 'username': 'sharath.rao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-02 22:05:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/glancemetadefcatalogapi.rst', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/044_update_metadef_os_nova_server.py', 'etc/metadefs/software-runtimes.json', 'etc/metadefs/software-webservers.json', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/035_add_metadef_tables.py', 'doc/source/metadefs-concepts.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1537903-54b2822eac6cfc09.yaml', 'etc/metadefs/software-databases.json'], 'message': 'Change Metadefs OS::Nova::Instance to OS::Nova::Server

The metadata definitions in etc/metadefs allow each namespace to be associated
with a resource type in OpenStack. Now that Horizon is supporting adding
metadata to instances (just got in during the mitaka cycle - so unrealeased),
I realized that we used OS::Nova::Instance instead of OS::Nova::Server in
Glance. This doesn’t align with Heat [0] or Searchlight [1].

There are a couple of metadef files that have OS::Nova::Instance that need to
change to OS::Nova::Server. I see also that OS::Nova:Instance is in one of
the db scripts. That script simply adds some initial "resource types" to the
database. [3]. It should be noted that there is no hard dependency on that
resource type to be in the DB script. You can add new resource types at any
time via API or JSON files and they are automatically added.

I'm not sure if the change to the db script needs to be done in a different
patch or not, but that can easily be accommodated.

See bug for additional links.

Change-Id: I196ce1d9a62a61027ccd444b17a30b2c018d9c84
Closes-Bug: 1537903
'}]
commit_message:
Change Metadefs OS::Nova::Instance to OS::Nova::Server

The metadata definitions in etc/metadefs allow each namespace to be associated
with a resource type in OpenStack. Now that Horizon is supporting adding
metadata to instances (just got in during the mitaka cycle - so unrealeased),
I realized that we used OS::Nova::Instance instead of OS::Nova::Server in
Glance. This doesn’t align with Heat [0] or Searchlight [1].

There are a couple of metadef files that have OS::Nova::Instance that need to
change to OS::Nova::Server. I see also that OS::Nova:Instance is in one of
the db scripts. That script simply adds some initial "resource types" to the
database. [3]. It should be noted that there is no hard dependency on that
resource type to be in the DB script. You can add new resource types at any
time via API or JSON files and they are automatically added.

I'm not sure if the change to the db script needs to be done in a different
patch or not, but that can easily be accommodated.

See bug for additional links.

Change-Id: I196ce1d9a62a61027ccd444b17a30b2c018d9c84
Closes-Bug: 1537903

commit_message:
Prevent user to remove last location of the image

If the last location of the image is removed, image transitions back to queued.
This allows user to upload new data into the existing image record. By
preventing removal of the last location we prevent the image transition back to
queued.

This change also prevents doing the same operation via replacing the locations
with empty list.

SecurityImpact
DocImpact
APIImpact

Conflicts:
	glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py

As pointed out by Brant Knudson in change [1], the sample policy file
allows the service user to validate tokens [2], so service users don't
need 'admin' role, they only need 'service'.

This patch adds the 'service' role creation to our tools/sample_data.sh
and updates service roles to it rather than 'admin'.

[1] Iebc4f6b005e0466fe60691d964c7dea0e0eee947

commit_message:
Do not assign admin to service users

As pointed out by Brant Knudson in change [1], the sample policy file
allows the service user to validate tokens [2], so service users don't
need 'admin' role, they only need 'service'.

This patch adds the 'service' role creation to our tools/sample_data.sh
and updates service roles to it rather than 'admin'.

[1] Iebc4f6b005e0466fe60691d964c7dea0e0eee947
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/etc/policy.json#n94

Change-Id: I3336514f7a2e1e749908d92b693d765c3ed48f51

Create neutron service in sample_data.sh

With the addition of Neutron to the sample_data.sh script, all services
required by the compute starter kit tag [1] are created (plus swift and ec2

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-02 06:21:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_validation.py', 'keystone/oauth1/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/oauth1/schema.py', 'keystone/oauth1/controllers.py'], 'message': "Add schema for OAuth1 consumer API

Add schema validation on create/update of OAuth1 consumer.

This patch also remove the unnecessary code after schema
validation enforcement.

- Remove the check of `secret` in request body for update
consumer API. It is covered by this schema definition.
 'not': {
     'required': ['secret']
 }

- Remove the check of `description` to consistent with other
entities, such as `user`, `group`. It is covered by the following
schema definition.
 'description': validation.nullable(parameter_types.description)

Partially implements: bp schema-validation-extent

Change-Id: I4d7e6188e8120aa4bcb4a27a22a34d7b395d5f49
"}]
commit_message:
Add schema for OAuth1 consumer API

Add schema validation on create/update of OAuth1 consumer.

This patch also remove the unnecessary code after schema
validation enforcement.

- Remove the check of `secret` in request body for update
consumer API. It is covered by this schema definition.
 'not': {
     'required': ['secret']
 }

- Remove the check of `description` to consistent with other
entities, such as `user`, `group`. It is covered by the following
schema definition.
 'description': validation.nullable(parameter_types.description)

Partially implements: bp schema-validation-extent

Change-Id: I4d7e6188e8120aa4bcb4a27a22a34d7b395d5f49

When the HostManager starts up, it loads the instance information for
all of the compute nodes. The call it uses, though, includes the records

commit_message:
Don't load deleted instances

When the HostManager starts up, it loads the instance information for
all of the compute nodes. The call it uses, though, includes the records
for deleted instances, which are not needed, and which can cause
performance issues for large deployments. This patch adds a filter on
deleted records.

Closes-bug: 1524421

Change-Id: I404b6baa5504316f447d9c504132183198ff689e
(cherry picked from commit 3d6fac8dea940b62e88f239c5615acc500b74f05)

commit_message:
Router: Add --route and --clear-routes options to "router set" command

--route option will enable users to set routes to the router.
--clear-routes option will help users to clear the routes associated
with the router.

Change-Id: I1af8a25bb89aa58c3e0e45ae26ee6c7daab3c656
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
Partial-bug: #1519503

subject: Allow IPv6 addresses/hostnames in StatsD target
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2696, 'name': 'Darrell Bishop', 'email': 'dbishop@nvidia.com', 'username': 'darrellb'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16896, 'name': 'Ondřej Nový', 'email': 'novy@ondrej.org', 'username': 'onovy'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-03 08:26:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deployment_guide.rst', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'doc/manpages/proxy-server.conf.5', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'doc/source/admin_guide.rst'], 'message': 'Allow IPv6 addresses/hostnames in StatsD target

The log_statsd_host value can now be an IPv6 address or a hostname
which only resolves to an IPv6 address.  In both cases, the new
behavior is to use an AF_INET6 socket on which .sendto() is called
with the originally-configured hostname (or IP).  This means the
Swift process is not caching a DNS resolution for the lifetime of
the process (a good thing).

If a hostname resolves to both an IPv6 or IPv4 address, an AF_INET
socket is used (i.e. only the IPv4 address will receive the UDP
packet).

The old behavior is preserved: any invalid IP address literals and
failures in DNS resolution or actual StatsD packet sending do not
halt the process or bubble up; they are caught, logged, and
otherwise ignored.

Change-Id: Ibddddcf140e2e69b08edf3feed3e9a5fa17307cf
'}]
commit_message:
Allow IPv6 addresses/hostnames in StatsD target

The log_statsd_host value can now be an IPv6 address or a hostname
which only resolves to an IPv6 address.  In both cases, the new
behavior is to use an AF_INET6 socket on which .sendto() is called
with the originally-configured hostname (or IP).  This means the
Swift process is not caching a DNS resolution for the lifetime of
the process (a good thing).

If a hostname resolves to both an IPv6 or IPv4 address, an AF_INET
socket is used (i.e. only the IPv4 address will receive the UDP
packet).

The old behavior is preserved: any invalid IP address literals and
failures in DNS resolution or actual StatsD packet sending do not
halt the process or bubble up; they are caught, logged, and
otherwise ignored.

Change-Id: Ibddddcf140e2e69b08edf3feed3e9a5fa17307cf

Class KeyValueListAction will be used to parse arguments like this:

--routes destination=xxx,nexthop=xxx --route destination=yyy,nexthop=yyy

The result is a list like this:

Change-Id: I45cce94d90eb26a63101361323c76e752821a972
'}]
commit_message:
Add KeyValueListAction to custom parser action

Class KeyValueListAction will be used to parse arguments like this:

--routes destination=xxx,nexthop=xxx --route destination=yyy,nexthop=yyy

The result is a list like this:

[{destination:xxx, nexthop:xxx}, {destination:yyy, nexthop:yyy}]

Change-Id: I45cce94d90eb26a63101361323c76e752821a972

commit_message:
Optimize router delete execution

Optimize the execution of router delete in the L3 agent
by not performing operations in the router namespace that
will be removed as the last step of the workflow.
Comparing the slopes of the least squares fit of delete
execution time shows that this optimization decreases that
slope by over half.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py
	neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py

Change-Id: Ic425ab1f8c3afe882c9deaa72a814ac0d2053f3b
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: 1512450
(cherry picked from commit 526dac467ba869284dd096c7a9e8251fb1bd4e85)

commit_message:
virt/libvirt: Consider live-resize limits when booting an instance.

set vcpu and maxMemory values in domain xml accordingly.

These files are outdated and not needed, translation is done using our
translation server. The current scripts work even when these files do
not exist. Once there are translated files, the files will be imported
automatically again and updated.

This is part of implementing the new infra setup for translations,
see spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/translation_setup.html

Change-Id: I43babe535f1784ce56da2dfcfcbdab7e0d5111c5

commit_message:
Remove outdated pot files

These files are outdated and not needed, translation is done using our
translation server. The current scripts work even when these files do
not exist. Once there are translated files, the files will be imported
automatically again and updated.

This is part of implementing the new infra setup for translations,
see spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/translation_setup.html
for full details.

Change-Id: I43babe535f1784ce56da2dfcfcbdab7e0d5111c5

subject: Add support for CMC requests
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-29 05:40:47.000000000', 'files': ['tests/fixups/test_fixup_functionality.py', 'anchor/certificate_ops.py', 'anchor/X509/signing_request.py', 'anchor/util.py', 'tests/X509/test_x509_csr.py', 'tests/validators/test_callable_validators.py', 'tests/test_signing_backend.py', 'tests/validators/test_base_validation_functions.py', 'tests/validators/test_standards_validator.py', 'anchor/cmc.py', 'tests/__init__.py'], 'message': "Add support for CMC requests

Incoming CMC requests should be stripped of all wrappers, then the internal
pkcs10 request is processed as usual. No verification is done on the SignedData
wrapper, because there's no known certificate to trust.

Response is just the bare certificate for now.

Change-Id: I92c76df775e5f339ac2fae95582097e3afe138af
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for CMC requests

Incoming CMC requests should be stripped of all wrappers, then the internal
pkcs10 request is processed as usual. No verification is done on the SignedData
wrapper, because there's no known certificate to trust.

Response is just the bare certificate for now.

Change-Id: I92c76df775e5f339ac2fae95582097e3afe138af

commit_message:
Added wheel-release job

This patch adds a wheel-release job on our release slave,
which is triggered after a wheel is built. It runs vos release,
to push the new entries in the filesystem to our AFS masters.

Change-Id: Ic1e8a6725fc046d8240a9665f6ed1167be53cb49
Depends-on: I81c39d420d8ac70def57949ea0d4c323b8797086

subject: Support listing network availability zones
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-02 14:10:38.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1534202-1ba78f0bb744961f.yaml', 'doc/source/commands.rst', 'openstackclient/tests/network/v2/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_availability_zone.py', 'openstackclient/common/availability_zone.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/availability-zone.rst'], 'message': 'Support listing network availability zones

Update the "os availability zone list" command to support listing
network availability zones along with the currently listed compute
and volume availability zones. This adds the --network option to
the command in order to only list network availability zones. By
default, all availability zones are listed. The --long option
was also updated to include a "Zone Resource" column which is
applicable to network availability zones. Example zone resources
include "network" and "router".

If the Network API does not support listing availability zones
then a warning message will be issued when the --network option
is specified.

This support requires an updated release of the SDK in order
to pull in [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk/+bug/1532274

Change-Id: I78811d659b793d9d2111ea54665d5fe7e4887264
Closes-Bug: #1534202
'}]
commit_message:
Support listing network availability zones

Update the "os availability zone list" command to support listing
network availability zones along with the currently listed compute
and volume availability zones. This adds the --network option to
the command in order to only list network availability zones. By
default, all availability zones are listed. The --long option
was also updated to include a "Zone Resource" column which is
applicable to network availability zones. Example zone resources
include "network" and "router".

If the Network API does not support listing availability zones
then a warning message will be issued when the --network option
is specified.

This support requires an updated release of the SDK in order
to pull in [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk/+bug/1532274

Change-Id: I78811d659b793d9d2111ea54665d5fe7e4887264
Closes-Bug: #1534202

Change-Id: Iab56cd1166028caed4f1e657e0b1ee81af3f48d8

commit_message:
Allow wait_for_delete to work for all clients

Allow the exception and error status
strings to be passed in such that other plugins can
make use of this function.

There is a comment in find_resource:
  The exception to catch here is dependent on which
  client library the manager passed in belongs to.
  Eventually this should be pulled from a common set
  of client exceptions.

Since I think that is a long ways off, this change will
work now and also work when a common exception is defined
and used.

Change-Id: Iab56cd1166028caed4f1e657e0b1ee81af3f48d8

subject: Fix vs_port usage in Red Hat distros
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 10:07:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/vs_port/ovs_redhat.rb'], 'message': 'Fix vs_port usage in Red Hat distros

Commit f39a4ca961ac1353b48c60d2c27aebba8ae1b2da moved constant
creation inside a do block to avoid duplication warnings, but at
the same time renamed them to self::BASE and self::DEFAULT, causing
issues when those variables where used elsewhere (e.g. in
lib/puppetx/redhat/ifcfg.rb).

Renaming those variables back and using ||= for assignment removes
the warning, while at the same time fixes the issues created by the
previous commit.

Change-Id: I3a02710811d91e141d56ab476dd32c3c7cf0ca80
(cherry picked from commit eb1677526ceaa97b98b7b85e23b3a6b95b5eaf2f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix vs_port usage in Red Hat distros

Commit f39a4ca961ac1353b48c60d2c27aebba8ae1b2da moved constant
creation inside a do block to avoid duplication warnings, but at
the same time renamed them to self::BASE and self::DEFAULT, causing
issues when those variables where used elsewhere (e.g. in
lib/puppetx/redhat/ifcfg.rb).

Renaming those variables back and using ||= for assignment removes
the warning, while at the same time fixes the issues created by the
previous commit.

Change-Id: I3a02710811d91e141d56ab476dd32c3c7cf0ca80
(cherry picked from commit eb1677526ceaa97b98b7b85e23b3a6b95b5eaf2f)

Apache knows .txt files are text/plain by default, but doesn't know
what to make of .log files. Rather than hack encoding overrides into
our logserver vhost, just rename the log files by tox only
in run-tox.sh before uploading so that they can be served properly.

Change-Id: I03cba279037259fcaa5073d67caf23662b3a59d2

commit_message:
Rename .log to .log.txt in run-tox

Apache knows .txt files are text/plain by default, but doesn't know
what to make of .log files. Rather than hack encoding overrides into
our logserver vhost, just rename the log files by tox only
in run-tox.sh before uploading so that they can be served properly.

Change-Id: I03cba279037259fcaa5073d67caf23662b3a59d2

subject: dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 22:18:11.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-docker-utils/functions.sh'], 'message': 'dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

Closes-Bug: #1536198
DocImpact
Change-Id: I9d3e5c910fb724d26fdc5fc40bd40ef2499fedc5
'}]
commit_message:
dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

Closes-Bug: #1536198
DocImpact
Change-Id: I9d3e5c910fb724d26fdc5fc40bd40ef2499fedc5

commit_message:
Prevent _heal_instance_info_cache() periodic lazy-loads

This fixes _heal_instance_info_cache() so that it speculatively loads
the flavor information for an instance during initial query, instead of
always depending on lazy-load to get it (which triggers an extra RPC
and DB call for every instance).

Change-Id: Ia1d78fb48d3f131487bd7a98d3a50774c85a1fa2
Partial-Bug: #1540526

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-01-30 20:31:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_masking.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vmax.py'], 'message': 'EMC VMAX - Fix for last volume in VMAX3 storage group

This patch fixes bug in the deletion the last volume in a
storage group for the VMAX3. If a masking view did not exist
we tried to get an instance of it which threw an exception.
Now we handle both scenarios correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1512796

Change-Id: Ideb2aaffe4fbc1ae2137d569d7b137ac0edef573
'}]
commit_message:
EMC VMAX - Fix for last volume in VMAX3 storage group

This patch fixes bug in the deletion the last volume in a
storage group for the VMAX3. If a masking view did not exist
we tried to get an instance of it which threw an exception.
Now we handle both scenarios correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1512796

Change-Id: Ideb2aaffe4fbc1ae2137d569d7b137ac0edef573

The federated authentication API might return the wrong list of authentication
methods when rescoping tokens. This patch exposes those bugs in the current

commit_message:
Expose method list inconsistency in federation api

The federated authentication API might return the wrong list of authentication
methods when rescoping tokens. This patch exposes those bugs in the current
tests and documents them.

Related-Bug: 1501032

Change-Id: I327e4c0c5b58e1c1ab2ea7417773ed5c7546baf3

subject: Handle cases where exc_args can't be serialized as JSON in the WBE
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-28 23:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/server.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_failure.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_protocol.py', 'taskflow/types/failure.py', 'taskflow/engines/worker_based/protocol.py'], 'message': "Handle cases where exc_args can't be serialized as JSON in the WBE

First try to get them, but if they aren't able to be serialized,
just return the failure without them.  This only affects the WBE
that serializes failures as part of the JSON response that is sent
over the wire from the worker process to the WBE engine.

Change-Id: I86e3255b612bc15097aabe63a684cf8b8808e61b
"}]
commit_message:
Handle cases where exc_args can't be serialized as JSON in the WBE

First try to get them, but if they aren't able to be serialized,
just return the failure without them.  This only affects the WBE
that serializes failures as part of the JSON response that is sent
over the wire from the worker process to the WBE engine.

Change-Id: I86e3255b612bc15097aabe63a684cf8b8808e61b

subject: sanitize IPv6 in keystone provider
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 17:23:03.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_spec.rb'], 'message': 'sanitize IPv6 in keystone provider

In keystone.rb provider, we need to make sure the ipv6 returned in
clean_host method has brackets.
If brackets are missing, the provider will fail to manage Keystone
resources, because of parsing issue and the multiple ":" in the host
value.

Change-Id: Ibdb340642270afae64b1055ef5fb97281b17066d
Closes-Bug: #1541512
(cherry picked from commit f710bed6aa445c33d3d307bdc144b6f7534d1282)
'}]
commit_message:
sanitize IPv6 in keystone provider

In keystone.rb provider, we need to make sure the ipv6 returned in
clean_host method has brackets.
If brackets are missing, the provider will fail to manage Keystone
resources, because of parsing issue and the multiple ":" in the host
value.

Change-Id: Ibdb340642270afae64b1055ef5fb97281b17066d
Closes-Bug: #1541512
(cherry picked from commit f710bed6aa445c33d3d307bdc144b6f7534d1282)

In keystone.rb provider, we need to make sure the ipv6 returned in

If brackets are missing, the provider will fail to manage Keystone
resources, because of parsing issue and the multiple ":" in the host

Change-Id: Ibdb340642270afae64b1055ef5fb97281b17066d
Closes-Bug: #1541512
'}]
commit_message:
sanitize IPv6 in keystone provider

In keystone.rb provider, we need to make sure the ipv6 returned in
clean_host method has brackets.
If brackets are missing, the provider will fail to manage Keystone
resources, because of parsing issue and the multiple ":" in the host
value.

Change-Id: Ibdb340642270afae64b1055ef5fb97281b17066d
Closes-Bug: #1541512

[{'number': 34, 'created': '2016-02-03 17:34:19.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/afs-slug.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/wheel-build.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/wheel-copy.sh', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/wheel-mirror.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/wheel-index.sh'], 'message': "Create jobs for a wheel mirror

In order to speed up tests where we install python packages we want to

This patch creates four new scripts:

* afs-slug, which generates a string version of the platform architecture,
  derived from the host system's parameters.
* wheel-build, which generates all wheels, from all branches, in `pwd`/wheels
* wheel-copy, which copies this wheels directory into our AFS file structure.
* wheel-index, which rebuilds the index.html file from the directories

commit_message:
Create jobs for a wheel mirror

In order to speed up tests where we install python packages we want to
create wheels for packages we depend on.

This patch creates four new scripts:

* afs-slug, which generates a string version of the platform architecture,
  derived from the host system's parameters.
* wheel-build, which generates all wheels, from all branches, in `pwd`/wheels
* wheel-copy, which copies this wheels directory into our AFS file structure.
* wheel-index, which rebuilds the index.html file from the directories
  found in the afs directory.

The above scripts are executed in sequence, with afs credentials only loaded
where necessary. Additional timeouts have been provided to prevent things from
locking.

This patch assumes that a mod_rewrite rule will be available on the serving nodes
that unmunges the URL.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Depends-On: Ie33861dbcb413c34012820fda76f8be94fb1d151
Depends-On: I81c39d420d8ac70def57949ea0d4c323b8797086
Change-Id: I3463fba889239c565c86ffb080adffd7bfdd18f9

Refactored the 'os security group delete' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client when
nova network is enabled.

to be used for commands that must support neutron and nova network.
The new class allows both the parser and actions to be unique.

commit_message:
Refactor security group delete to use SDK

Refactored the 'os security group delete' command to use the SDK
when neutron is enabled, but continue to use the nova client when
nova network is enabled.

This patch set introduces a new NetworkAndComputeCommand class
to be used for commands that must support neutron and nova network.
The new class allows both the parser and actions to be unique.
The current DeleteSecurityGroup class is now a subclass of this
new class and has moved under the network v2 commands.

This patch set also introduces a new FakeSecurityGroup class for
testing security groups.

And finally, this patch set updates the command documentation
for security group and security group rule to indicate that
Network v2 is also used.

Change-Id: Ic21376b86b40cc6d97f360f3760ba5beed154537
Partial-Bug: #1519511
Related-to: blueprint neutron-client

commit_message:
Make libvirt live migration transportation type configurable

Libvirt support a range of transports, currently the live migration only
uses ssh, and it will be better that the transport type configurable.

Because different transport type has different URI format, we keep the live
migration URI as configuration.

Change-Id: Ib8740a8fcd3292c63e27254b0b53ea86a1d8775a

commit_message:
Add exc_filter for invalid Unicode string

This error occurs if passing a Unicode string to the
database which cannot be stored (i.e. it contains chars
>4 bytes long and the db is not configured to handle
that).

Change-Id: I12311909dec6e447c93917a5efd68599f35c4b89
Related-Bug: #1393871

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-03 15:07:33.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Add an extra tempest worker by default

Tempest with 4 worker might not be well balanced,
it is possible one worker runs for 18 minutes,
the other for 46 minutes.

By using an extra worker, each worker needs to
run less test, it is expected to help us to finish earlier,
even if the cpu load will be little bit higher
in the first 15 minute.

Change-Id: I89d3e69da2daa2eba1a3b189e157fc3f8ab170db
'}]
commit_message:
Add an extra tempest worker by default

Tempest with 4 worker might not be well balanced,
it is possible one worker runs for 18 minutes,
the other for 46 minutes.

By using an extra worker, each worker needs to
run less test, it is expected to help us to finish earlier,
even if the cpu load will be little bit higher
in the first 15 minute.

Change-Id: I89d3e69da2daa2eba1a3b189e157fc3f8ab170db

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

subject: Stop n-net with n-cpu for partial upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-10 12:32:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'Stop n-net with n-cpu for partial upgrades

In a real environment, n-net will be co-located with n-cpu, and
upgraded at the same time. For the sake of expediency, this patch
makes n-cpu and n-net be started and stopped at the same time as
"the compute family of services." Grenade's existing partial upgrade
support will still apply, and we'll get a more realistic test.

Since grenade uses devstack old to do the shutdown, we need to backport
moving n-net to stop_nova_compute to make Kilo -> master (Liberty) job work.
But we don't want to move n-net to start_nova_compute in order to make
sure Juno->Kilo still works (and does restart nova-compute during
partial upgrade).

Generating a new change ID, so we can use depends on.

(cherry picked from commit 18e9151b03583ba2426e95fc74d1733633777eb0)
Co-Authored-By: Joe Gordon <joe.gordon0@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibf22143cb0a1bd56d8457eff6d2807307d264ae0
'}]
commit_message:
Stop n-net with n-cpu for partial upgrades

In a real environment, n-net will be co-located with n-cpu, and
upgraded at the same time. For the sake of expediency, this patch
makes n-cpu and n-net be started and stopped at the same time as
"the compute family of services." Grenade's existing partial upgrade
support will still apply, and we'll get a more realistic test.

Since grenade uses devstack old to do the shutdown, we need to backport
moving n-net to stop_nova_compute to make Kilo -> master (Liberty) job work.
But we don't want to move n-net to start_nova_compute in order to make
sure Juno->Kilo still works (and does restart nova-compute during
partial upgrade).

Generating a new change ID, so we can use depends on.

(cherry picked from commit 18e9151b03583ba2426e95fc74d1733633777eb0)
Co-Authored-By: Joe Gordon <joe.gordon0@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Change dump target in settings to /var/dump.

This will make use of new dump placing introduced by library change this
patch depends on. Dump will be on the same block device as /var/log,
which will make use of additional disk space available in /var/log.

Change-Id: Iec127e0d11194c7a89a2fb80203f173dc4ca3c98
Closes-bug: 1529182
Depends-on: I0c0832d0c10350898b16d68ed195677fcf975377

Change-Id: I97cc3758d5c97494704406d779a7326420940427

commit_message:
Be explicit when installing clients from src

Most jobs installing client libs from pypi now, this means that we don't
need set up the client lib git repos by default in devstack-gate. But
before we can clean up devstack-gate the jobs that do need the clients
need to explicitly state that.

Note that this also setups up ironic and related things because of how
the ironic jobs work they all share a common macro.

Change-Id: I97cc3758d5c97494704406d779a7326420940427

subject: Restart horizon when package/venvs change
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-03 12:14:22.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/horizon_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/tasks/horizon_pre_install.yml'], 'message': 'Restart horizon when package/venvs change

Currently, upgrading a horizon package/venv does not explicitly trigger
a restart.  A restart will only occur if an explicit or implicit config
change occurs.

This commit adds several restart notifiers such that a horizon package
upgrade or venv replacement will force a restart.

Note that this issue exists in all OpenStack roles at the moment, but
the remaining roles are being addressed in their re-deploy venv
reviews.  The horizon re-deploy venv change was merged a while back
which is why we need the separate review for this.

Change-Id: I890e46bb7a2973c3582be7a37ee70730d1e3ffef
(cherry picked from commit 023f73d3a906ead60ccd1d5e8be961bfe635ab16)
'}]
commit_message:
Restart horizon when package/venvs change

Currently, upgrading a horizon package/venv does not explicitly trigger
a restart.  A restart will only occur if an explicit or implicit config
change occurs.

This commit adds several restart notifiers such that a horizon package
upgrade or venv replacement will force a restart.

Note that this issue exists in all OpenStack roles at the moment, but
the remaining roles are being addressed in their re-deploy venv
reviews.  The horizon re-deploy venv change was merged a while back
which is why we need the separate review for this.

Change-Id: I890e46bb7a2973c3582be7a37ee70730d1e3ffef
(cherry picked from commit 023f73d3a906ead60ccd1d5e8be961bfe635ab16)

subject: Network: Abstract get_body() out to be a private helper.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-02 06:08:45.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/network/v2/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/network/v2/network.py', 'openstackclient/tests/network/v2/test_network.py'], 'message': 'Network: Abstract get_body() out to be a private helper.

get_body() is needed in each network files to construct a dict
to pass to sdk proxy. And it is also used by several functions
in each file. So define it as a file level private helper function.

The unified prototype should be:

    def _get_attrs(client_manager, parsed_args):

1. The name, in sdk, the parameter passed to proxy is named "attrs".
   And it is a private method. So let's call it _get_attrs().
2. The parameters, besides parsed_args, when we deal with project
   and project_domain, we have to make use of identity_client. So
   let's pass in the client manager.

Change-Id: Ib044ebd4ddedbcd805f46334a7fe99e4ebb5b249
'}]
commit_message:
Network: Abstract get_body() out to be a private helper.

get_body() is needed in each network files to construct a dict
to pass to sdk proxy. And it is also used by several functions
in each file. So define it as a file level private helper function.

The unified prototype should be:

    def _get_attrs(client_manager, parsed_args):

1. The name, in sdk, the parameter passed to proxy is named "attrs".
   And it is a private method. So let's call it _get_attrs().
2. The parameters, besides parsed_args, when we deal with project
   and project_domain, we have to make use of identity_client. So
   let's pass in the client manager.

Change-Id: Ib044ebd4ddedbcd805f46334a7fe99e4ebb5b249

subject: avoid to premature restart nova-compute by ceilometer
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 13948, 'name': 'Bartłomiej Piotrowski', 'email': 'bpiotrowski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'bpiotrowski'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15660, 'name': 'Olesia Tsvigun', 'email': 'otsvigun@mirantis.com', 'username': 'otsvigun'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 13:48:31.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/ceilometer/compute.pp'], 'message': "avoid to premature restart nova-compute by ceilometer

There is ceilometer-compute compute task that configures ceilometer
and restarts nova-compute in order to apply new settings. It is totally
correct behaviour for compute node. But for compute-vmware it restarts
unconfigured nova-compute. As a result nova-compute starts
with the wrong parameter host (nodename instead vcenter-servicename)
and registers in the nova database with that paramter. Then
top-role-compute-vmware sets right value for host and restarts
nova-compute that also registers in the database.

Therefore we got the record in the database for nova-compute and host a
equal nodename. When ostf test checks that all process are alive it
found this record and decides that it's dead. And test failed.

This commit allows to avoid premature restarts nova-compute before it
will configured and solves this problem.

Change-Id: Ica3136423303c4ed9f36a194080d3489a793f980
Closes-bug: #1529840
"}]
commit_message:
avoid to premature restart nova-compute by ceilometer

There is ceilometer-compute compute task that configures ceilometer
and restarts nova-compute in order to apply new settings. It is totally
correct behaviour for compute node. But for compute-vmware it restarts
unconfigured nova-compute. As a result nova-compute starts
with the wrong parameter host (nodename instead vcenter-servicename)
and registers in the nova database with that paramter. Then
top-role-compute-vmware sets right value for host and restarts
nova-compute that also registers in the database.

Therefore we got the record in the database for nova-compute and host a
equal nodename. When ostf test checks that all process are alive it
found this record and decides that it's dead. And test failed.

This commit allows to avoid premature restarts nova-compute before it
will configured and solves this problem.

Change-Id: Ica3136423303c4ed9f36a194080d3489a793f980
Closes-bug: #1529840

commit_message:
Re-Enable django_openstack_auth/designate-dashboard translations

Also, remove liberty jobs for these so that we do not need to backport
or handle them extra.

Backporting would break packaging by third parties, therefore not an
option.

Designate-dashboard setup is broken in liberty anyhow, so no need to
handle it extra. django_openstack_auth is good translated, and we're at
the end of translation.

Besides re-enabling the translations using the new setup, we can now
remove the old function setup_django_openstack_auth since it's not used
anymore.

Story: 2000452
Change-Id: I8b72a148d0f0e89d61807eee50a772e1fbcecaa2

subject: Fix Port resource properties
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-27 22:40:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_port.py', 'openstack/network/v2/port.py'], 'message': 'Fix Port resource properties

While implementing the OpenStackClient "port show" command [1],
the following problems were identified with the Port resource
object:
  -- allowed_address_pairs is not a dict
  -- binding_profile is a dict
  -- dns_assignment was not explicitely parsed
  -- dns_name was not explicitely parsed
  -- extra_dhcp_opts is not a dict
  -- security_groups is a list

Most of these problems do not cause any issues for the "port show"
command. However, the allowed_address_pairs and extra_dhcp_opts
problems cause the "port show" command to fail due to SDK parsing
problems when these properties contain data.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/273242/

Change-Id: Ifd94cd2176ebc868b023cdc260d38f147955f772
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Port resource properties

While implementing the OpenStackClient "port show" command [1],
the following problems were identified with the Port resource
object:
  -- allowed_address_pairs is not a dict
  -- binding_profile is a dict
  -- dns_assignment was not explicitely parsed
  -- dns_name was not explicitely parsed
  -- extra_dhcp_opts is not a dict
  -- security_groups is a list

Most of these problems do not cause any issues for the "port show"
command. However, the allowed_address_pairs and extra_dhcp_opts
problems cause the "port show" command to fail due to SDK parsing
problems when these properties contain data.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/273242/

Change-Id: Ifd94cd2176ebc868b023cdc260d38f147955f772

subject: Remove conditional checking the auth_strategy values
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-03 14:25:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/dhcp/neutron.py'], 'message': 'Remove conditional checking the auth_strategy values

In the dhcp/neutron.py module there was a conditional checking if
the values of the CONF.neutron.auth_strategy was set to "noauth" or
"keystone". That check is not needed anymore since that configuration
option is now using the "choices" parameter from oslo.config to limit
and check what are the valid values for that configuration option.

Change-Id: I61c5e83b06a370bbc4cca48c8812f9b4b934aef8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove conditional checking the auth_strategy values

In the dhcp/neutron.py module there was a conditional checking if
the values of the CONF.neutron.auth_strategy was set to "noauth" or
"keystone". That check is not needed anymore since that configuration
option is now using the "choices" parameter from oslo.config to limit
and check what are the valid values for that configuration option.

Change-Id: I61c5e83b06a370bbc4cca48c8812f9b4b934aef8

commit_message:
Use regex for matching node in rabbit-fence logs

Currently it's possible to add special prefixes for
hostnames which are used by RabbitMQ (messaging network).
Modified tests, so such prefixes are ignored while
parsing rabbit-fence logs.

Also change 'get_rabbit_running_nodes' method to
omit node name prefixes while returning list of running
nodes.

Change-Id: I63bac7c4eafa61fc756d033dadd7d2ba662eaf4c
Closes-bug: #1538597
Closes-bug: #1539586

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-01-19 06:16:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/fip_rule_priority_allocator.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_fip_rule_priority_allocator.py'], 'message': "Unify ip rule priority in router namespace

It doesn't seem to be necessary to have unique priorities for every
rule as long as the rules are not ambiguous and don't need to be
prioritized.  Removing this reduces the complexity a lot.

Since IP overlap is not enable in router namespace, every rule in
router namespace should be unique, not ambiguous. And for future plan
to enable IP overlap in router namespace, we can add 'iif' parameter
to locate ip rules.

The following link is a discussion reference about keeping ip rule
in the same priority if they are not ambiguous:
http://marc.info/?l=linux-netdev&m=145255331814388&w=2

Co-Authored-By: ZongKai LI <lzklibj@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I78a5dc0bed948a89362b7b288b43df3d8ac4bba2
"}]
commit_message:
Unify ip rule priority in router namespace

It doesn't seem to be necessary to have unique priorities for every
rule as long as the rules are not ambiguous and don't need to be
prioritized.  Removing this reduces the complexity a lot.

Since IP overlap is not enable in router namespace, every rule in
router namespace should be unique, not ambiguous. And for future plan
to enable IP overlap in router namespace, we can add 'iif' parameter
to locate ip rules.

The following link is a discussion reference about keeping ip rule
in the same priority if they are not ambiguous:
http://marc.info/?l=linux-netdev&m=145255331814388&w=2

Co-Authored-By: ZongKai LI <lzklibj@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I78a5dc0bed948a89362b7b288b43df3d8ac4bba2

1) utils.cleaning_error_handler() as hook in current code does not
have an exception parameter that task context manager adds.
2) It's not needed to set fail state on "NoFreeConductorWorker"
exception, this is driver specific. IPA driver can obtain a free

commit_message:
Fix spawn error hook in "continue_node_clean" RPC method

1) utils.cleaning_error_handler() as hook in current code does not
have an exception parameter that task context manager adds.
2) It's not needed to set fail state on "NoFreeConductorWorker"
exception, this is driver specific. IPA driver can obtain a free
worker on the next heartbeat(s).

This patch also adds missing tests for error handlers functions.

Closes-Bug: #1539118
Change-Id: I9081d5b3437e9be6b68fe9c635b38f84637e93df

In the Liberty release, the NFS driver deprecated the 'nfs_used_ratio'
and 'nfs_oversubscription_ratio' configuration options since equivalent
common functionality is now provided across drivers by the scheduler-aware
'reserved_percentage' and 'max_over_sucscription_ratio' configuration
options.

This commit removes these deprecated options, tests for same, and
some Liberty code that proviced backwards compatibility with respect to
these options.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia3af9cbe69b2342649fe378aefe6ed1e46a82b19
"}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated options from NFS driver

In the Liberty release, the NFS driver deprecated the 'nfs_used_ratio'
and 'nfs_oversubscription_ratio' configuration options since equivalent
common functionality is now provided across drivers by the scheduler-aware
'reserved_percentage' and 'max_over_sucscription_ratio' configuration
options.

This commit removes these deprecated options, tests for same, and
some Liberty code that proviced backwards compatibility with respect to
these options.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia3af9cbe69b2342649fe378aefe6ed1e46a82b19

commit_message:
Implied Roles API

CRD for implied roles.
Iplied roles are expanded in token issue and validation responses.
Explicitly forbids creating a rule with admin as the implied role to
  avoid escalation of privileges.

Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
implements: blueprint implied-roles
Change-Id: I812843adb9a1748fb471325797dad80e1baea565

commit_message:
Comment out test options that already exists on tempest's tree

Since we can't remove ironic's  tests and options from tempest's tree
until liberty-eol (to tests stable branches) we can't have such options
on our tree, except of course new options like deploywait_timeout.

Change-Id: I563908626995b7f711e7bc3d1b756aa8dae7d261

commit_message:
Add prefix to nodes hostnames in rabbit-fence

In this commit Ifc2af16b08663655d365587ea6f45c87bfc68698
we started to use prefixes for hostnames which point to
addresses from 'mgmt/messaging' network.
Adding corresponding change to the rabbit-fence code.

Change-Id: I7629d2b6e3cc672a75c49accf63b6bc5e130c843
Closes-bug: #1538597

subject: ODL v2: Check for CREATE operations only in validate method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 20:20:11.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/db/db.py'], 'message': 'ODL v2: Check for CREATE operations only in validate method

The validation method _check_for_pending_or_processing_ops() should be
limited to check against operation=CREATE rows.

As currently used, this method may return rows where the operation type
is UPDATE.

Change-Id: I11a9503fe4b8522117f289b218c68fc00af4be0b
Closes-Bug: #1541085
'}]
commit_message:
ODL v2: Check for CREATE operations only in validate method

The validation method _check_for_pending_or_processing_ops() should be
limited to check against operation=CREATE rows.

As currently used, this method may return rows where the operation type
is UPDATE.

Change-Id: I11a9503fe4b8522117f289b218c68fc00af4be0b
Closes-Bug: #1541085

subject: Check context before returning cached value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 05:06:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/keymgr/test_barbican.py', 'cinder/keymgr/barbican.py'], 'message': 'Check context before returning cached value

The key manager caches the value of barbican client to be reused,
saving an extra call to keystone.  The cached value is only
applicable to the current context, so the context must be checked
before returning the cached value.

Change-Id: Ib10909a098fb2cd070129c239b6d3b95edc8fea0
Closes-Bug: #1523646
(cherry picked from commit 0832a0355381229ece235440a9c5de1301e51d07)
'}]
commit_message:
Check context before returning cached value

The key manager caches the value of barbican client to be reused,
saving an extra call to keystone.  The cached value is only
applicable to the current context, so the context must be checked
before returning the cached value.

Change-Id: Ib10909a098fb2cd070129c239b6d3b95edc8fea0
Closes-Bug: #1523646
(cherry picked from commit 0832a0355381229ece235440a9c5de1301e51d07)

commit_message:
Create nova-api database

This is a required patch.

Kilo introduced a nova-api database but didn't use it. [1]
Mitaka now uses it and has broken booting instances. [2]

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Kilo#OpenStack_Compute_.28Nova.29
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/df0fca62cf5324f5b6eae0fed1f88c6c9ed61c71/releasenotes/notes/request-spec-api-db-b9cc6e0624d563c5.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1540579

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-02-03 13:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/libvirt-deprecate-migration-flags-config-4ba1e2d6c9ef09ff.yaml', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: deprecate live/block_migration_flag opts

Some of the migration flags really should never be changed by users
since the code makes fundamental assumptions about their use.

Now that live_migration_tunnelled is available, there shouldn't be any
remaining use cases for the live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
options.

Deprecate these for removal in a future release.

Change-Id: I69c4bdf47a7b34b8dc8cfa58f3d0e0557b5ce072
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: deprecate live/block_migration_flag opts

Some of the migration flags really should never be changed by users
since the code makes fundamental assumptions about their use.

Now that live_migration_tunnelled is available, there shouldn't be any
remaining use cases for the live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
options.

Deprecate these for removal in a future release.

Change-Id: I69c4bdf47a7b34b8dc8cfa58f3d0e0557b5ce072
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

commit_message:
HTTP errors have full error message

If HTTP error contains error message in json response, it is appended to
an exception raised.

exceptions_decorator is not used in fuel2, cliff has it's own error
handling

Change-Id: I8582e67e2061f5c941a22d32b0f4339f30142be2
Closes-bug: 1514906

commit_message:
Fix gate failures

Since Gnocchi 2.0, we return the full resource instead of just the id.

This change pretty prints the resource in that case.
And fixes the unit tests to match current master branch representation.

Then Gnocchi 2.0, doesn't provide keystone by default anymore and
provide a new paste configuration.

This change removes the custom paste/policy configurations.

Also Gnocchi 2.0, doesn't conver user/project id in UUID anymore.
So tests around that are removed

Change-Id: I89b4846a7f1efddac4cc6ae7c8f6323046c12adf

commit_message:
Make dse2 tests run properly with tox -enew_arch

Previously, the dse2 tests didn't run with tox -enew_arch
since there was no __init__.py file in the dir.  Also,
the tests weren't set up to use the distributed_architecture
flag.

This change addresses both issues.

Implements: blueprint dist-integrate-new-dse
Change-Id: Ie1d733b8a4e3df18b689628890a4ee632fb43905

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-02 15:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-docker-utils/functions.sh'], 'message': 'dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

Change-Id: I3945200d02b29ed10e60900f7d03ed30970159a3
Closes-Bug: #1536198
DocImpact
'}]
commit_message:
dockerctl: Update authorized_keys in bootstrap images during restore

After backup-reinstall-restore Fuel uses bootstrap with wrong ssh keys.

dockerctl backup procedure does not save the bootstrap's root
filesystem, which holds the list of authorized keys that should be
matching the private key located in /root/.ssh on the master.
It would result in inaccessible nodes from a new master installation
(which has bootstrap images regenerated with a new key, not matching
the original one, restored from the backup).

This patch updates authorized_keys inside squashfsed bootstrap images,
so it will be retained during backup-reinstall-restore procedure, if
user has not requested a full backup. Full backups already contain a
full copy of /var/www/nailgun, so no changes are needed.

User should carefully restore from non-full backups - only active
bootstrap will have its ssh keys updated. To propagate ssh keys to
already running nodes, you can use something like:
  mco rpc --agent execute_shell_command --action execute --arg cmd="echo '$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)' >> /root/.ssh/authorized_keys" -v

Change-Id: I3945200d02b29ed10e60900f7d03ed30970159a3
Closes-Bug: #1536198
DocImpact

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1091, 'name': 'Arun Kant', 'email': 'arukant@cisco.com', 'username': 'arunkant-uws'}, {'_account_id': 7789, 'name': 'John Wood', 'email': 'john.wood@rackspace.com', 'username': 'woodster'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendizábal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 9914, 'name': 'Ade Lee', 'email': 'alee@redhat.com', 'username': 'alee'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}, {'_account_id': 16046, 'name': 'Fernando Diaz', 'email': 'diazjf@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'diazjf'}, {'_account_id': 18623, 'name': 'Pankaj Khandar', 'email': 'pankaj.khandar@gmail.com', 'username': 'Pan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-29 06:02:37.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/versions.py'], 'message': 'Use host href for version discovery

In barbican we already use the host_href coming from the configuration
to return the paths the user needs to use to retrieve their respective
secrets. This, however, is not the case for version discovery. The
version discovery (json-home) implementation done in barbican will
return the path by which barbican was accessed. This is problematic
because it might not be the path that we want to expose barbican
through. On the other hand, we might want to enforce the usage of TLS
for accessing barbican; This will not be the case if there is a
possibility of accessing barbican through plain HTTP (in the case where
the loadbalancer is not explicitly blocking so).

As a solution, the json-home output will be the value that was
configured in the host_href option. This will then return endpoints for
keystone discovery that coincide with the paths that are returned with
entities.

Change-Id: I69f556c09f072b47e9f8e776ccd4db209b25485f
'}]
commit_message:
Use host href for version discovery

In barbican we already use the host_href coming from the configuration
to return the paths the user needs to use to retrieve their respective
secrets. This, however, is not the case for version discovery. The
version discovery (json-home) implementation done in barbican will
return the path by which barbican was accessed. This is problematic
because it might not be the path that we want to expose barbican
through. On the other hand, we might want to enforce the usage of TLS
for accessing barbican; This will not be the case if there is a
possibility of accessing barbican through plain HTTP (in the case where
the loadbalancer is not explicitly blocking so).

As a solution, the json-home output will be the value that was
configured in the host_href option. This will then return endpoints for
keystone discovery that coincide with the paths that are returned with
entities.

Change-Id: I69f556c09f072b47e9f8e776ccd4db209b25485f

commit_message:
Use regex for matching node in rabbit-fence logs

Currently it's possible to add special prefixes for
hostnames which are used by RabbitMQ (messaging network).
Modified tests, so such prefixes are ignored while
parsing rabbit-fence logs.

Also change 'get_rabbit_running_nodes' method to
omit node name prefixes while returning list of running
nodes.

Change-Id: I63bac7c4eafa61fc756d033dadd7d2ba662eaf4c
Closes-bug: #1538597
Closes-bug: #1539586

commit_message:
manila CI hook: disable glusterfs protocol

manila's cephfs-native CI tests cephfs driver, which does not support
glusterfs protocol. The glusterfs protocol is enabled by a manila's
tempest config option by default. Modify the config option to disable
glusterfs protocol.

Change-Id: Ia7a226d6a8b0ba5aeedcdf34e8a6f9a8dbbfda40
Closes-Bug: #1541377

commit_message:
Remove implementation_signature check

Remove the unnecessary checking of implementation signature of
current resource with the prev_resource in needs_update.
It seems prev_resource is always resource from the backup_stack
and there would be no difference.

If there is a change of implementation class, it would have been
already handled[1]

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/update.py#L139-L140

doc: Use ovn-sbctl show.

The devstack testing doc still used ovsdb-client to look at the OVN
southbound database.  This was probably from before ovn-sbctl existed.
Switch this part to use "ovn-sbctl show" to see the list of chassis and
associated details.

Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: doc: Further reflect that OVN L3 is the default.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-29 22:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/testing.rst'], 'message': 'doc: Further reflect that OVN L3 is the default.

The devstack testing docs still had a lot of text based on the Neutron
L3 agent being enabled.  Change the docs to focus on what happens with
OVN L3 is enabled, since that is the default.

This mainly involves dropping references to the "public" network, router
ports, and the use of floating IPs.

Change-Id: I08e42a02e3b8d6e7dfe7fac09632f190458fd50e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
doc: Further reflect that OVN L3 is the default.

The devstack testing docs still had a lot of text based on the Neutron
L3 agent being enabled.  Change the docs to focus on what happens with
OVN L3 is enabled, since that is the default.

This mainly involves dropping references to the "public" network, router
ports, and the use of floating IPs.

Change-Id: I08e42a02e3b8d6e7dfe7fac09632f190458fd50e
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: Separate host group var in hosts plays
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-03 12:15:03.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-hosts-setup.yml', 'playbooks/openstack-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': 'Separate host group var in hosts plays

The old host group used in lxc_hosts and openstack_hosts was identical
in both plays. In some (if not many) environments, there is a
difference as some openstack_hosts do not have lxc containers.

In some situations such as diskless hypervisors, deploying the
lxc_hosts role to these nodes that do not use containers causes
unnecessary ramdisk clutter.

This minor change just separates the two variable references in these
plays so the operator can set for example:

lxc_host_group: "hosts:!compute_hosts"

Then my openstack_hosts play will still run on compute hosts as
expected.

Change-Id: Ib2b157b0e139f30792558535657d5d279c6a5fcc
(cherry picked from commit 8ededdd280073cbbfb0b0f5c658ee830060c2232)'}]
commit_message:
Separate host group var in hosts plays

The old host group used in lxc_hosts and openstack_hosts was identical
in both plays. In some (if not many) environments, there is a
difference as some openstack_hosts do not have lxc containers.

In some situations such as diskless hypervisors, deploying the
lxc_hosts role to these nodes that do not use containers causes
unnecessary ramdisk clutter.

This minor change just separates the two variable references in these
plays so the operator can set for example:

lxc_host_group: "hosts:!compute_hosts"

Then my openstack_hosts play will still run on compute hosts as
expected.

Change-Id: Ib2b157b0e139f30792558535657d5d279c6a5fcc
(cherry picked from commit 8ededdd280073cbbfb0b0f5c658ee830060c2232)

commit_message:
Use config option for host reference in versions

This patch changes the Versions resource such that the option for
`host_href` set in the conf file is used in the response generated by
the versions resource.

Closes-Bug: #1540651

commit_message:
Use pip_install_gr for os-testr

Use `pip_install_gr` instead of `pip_install -U` when installing
os-testr. This is the same approach that have just been approved in
the stable/kilo branch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274533/).

This is an improved way to install depencencies that do not conflict
with other ones defined in the global requirements repository.

Change-Id: I999faaabfdcf4530a1f0acb4906160fa027442a6

commit_message:
Fix test_context_middleware py34 error

This was expecting bytes, but stopped working...

The oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f
changed request_id type on Python 3 from bytes to str.

Change-Id: I9ab47455a0e054714dea5be755cae5ebce9b86d3
Closes-Bug: 1541147

commit_message:
add flag to collapse pre-releases into final releases

Add a new flag to combine pre-release notes into their final release
version after that version is tagged. The flag defaults to False to
preserve the current behavior.

Change-Id: I6b9c058289f0baa3e39048b3fa78f6af81bdd83b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix detection of pre-release tags in git log

We had two different regexes being used for detecting tags. Unify them
into a single expression that works in both situations.

Convert that expression to use "verbose" mode to include some inline
documentation for the parts of the pattern.

Add more details to the existing debug output when new tags are found.

Add more debug output at the end to show how many files were actually
detected.

Change-Id: I7104f459c948011f198fed04303ea5cafb59f223
Closes-Bug: #1537451
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update heat autoscaling test and test templates

Now Ceilometer does not support cpu_util metric. Thats why
it was needed to rewrite existing test_autoscaling to use another
metric (network.incoming.bytes).

Change-Id: I2cfda7624c9736e68d1d2fde4cdc37457cf5a593
Closes-bug:#1538166

commit_message:
Enable keystone handling of X-Forwarded-Proto header

If the X-Forwarded-Proto header is received by keystone, this option
will make the service properly handle it. This is useful, for instance,
if TLS is enabled for the admin endpoint.

Conflicts:
    puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml
    puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp

Change-Id: I31a1f51591e8423367e61eafc3af9b2d61278468
(cherry picked from commit fd9208025eae0304fa5b6936749fbee96cf9b814)

subject: add simpler instructions for adding new dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 18:18:40.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': 'add simpler instructions for adding new dependencies

Not every new dependency needs to completely recalculate the
upper-constraints.txt file. We want to know that the changes in that
file when we add something new are truly related to the new dependency,
and not just a side-effect of the update script discovering that there
has been a new release of something completely unrelated. The bot will
cover those updates separately.

Change-Id: Ieadf33401830550c6fae8f319661218071a1ad73
'}]
commit_message:
add simpler instructions for adding new dependencies

Not every new dependency needs to completely recalculate the
upper-constraints.txt file. We want to know that the changes in that
file when we add something new are truly related to the new dependency,
and not just a side-effect of the update script discovering that there
has been a new release of something completely unrelated. The bot will
cover those updates separately.

Change-Id: Ieadf33401830550c6fae8f319661218071a1ad73

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-01 01:29:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron-ovs-bridge-name-7b3477103622f4cc.yaml', 'nova/network/model.py'], 'message': 'neutronv2: Allow Neutron to specify OVS/LB bridge.

Previously, the OVS bridge name only came from nova.conf.  It will be
helpful to allow Neutron to specify the name.  In particular, this has
come up as a requirement for implementing Neutron's "vlan-aware-vms"
spec, which will require a separate bridge per port, at least for the
existing default ML2+OVS backend.  This patch will allow Neutron to
customize the bridge name on a per-port basis.

The implementation is quite simple, as the use of the config value was
already localized to a small area of code.  That code just has to prefer
a name in vif_details, but fall back to the config value, otherwise.

While not immediately needed, it seems convenient to go ahead and apply
the same change for VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE (linux bridge) and
VIF_TYPE_VHOSTUSER, since it's a trivial addition to the patch.

The test cases just follow the same pattern as several other test cases
for this code, but makes sure that a custom bridge name in vif_details
is honored.

Implements blueprint neutron-ovs-bridge-name.

Change-Id: I66c25e0c9d971163d0ddad186a0c49f20a77aaa9
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
neutronv2: Allow Neutron to specify OVS/LB bridge.

Previously, the OVS bridge name only came from nova.conf.  It will be
helpful to allow Neutron to specify the name.  In particular, this has
come up as a requirement for implementing Neutron's "vlan-aware-vms"
spec, which will require a separate bridge per port, at least for the
existing default ML2+OVS backend.  This patch will allow Neutron to
customize the bridge name on a per-port basis.

The implementation is quite simple, as the use of the config value was
already localized to a small area of code.  That code just has to prefer
a name in vif_details, but fall back to the config value, otherwise.

While not immediately needed, it seems convenient to go ahead and apply
the same change for VIF_TYPE_BRIDGE (linux bridge) and
VIF_TYPE_VHOSTUSER, since it's a trivial addition to the patch.

The test cases just follow the same pattern as several other test cases
for this code, but makes sure that a custom bridge name in vif_details
is honored.

Implements blueprint neutron-ovs-bridge-name.

Change-Id: I66c25e0c9d971163d0ddad186a0c49f20a77aaa9
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 17:11:44.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/type/glance_swift_config_spec.rb', 'manifests/backend/swift.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_swift_config.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/glance_swift_config/ini_setting.rb', 'spec/classes/glance_backend_swift_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/glance_swift_config/ini_setting_spec.rb'], 'message': "Use glance-swift conf for swift backend

For working with Swift backend, Glance needs authentication parameters,
which are supplied to Swift when making calls to its storage system.
Glance will use information from the file specified under parameter
swift_store_config_file. When this parameter is set to the same file
(glance-api.conf), we have lot of non-critical errors in glance-api
log, because of 'Invalid format of swift store config'.

The same problem, when we have RadosGW.

Change-Id: I18ee8f68f7ce793d2580685e79ed636556c57ddd

(cherry picked from commit c8b7d3319b00fe6cc72f3963f5f618bc176d18b4)
"}]
commit_message:
Use glance-swift conf for swift backend

For working with Swift backend, Glance needs authentication parameters,
which are supplied to Swift when making calls to its storage system.
Glance will use information from the file specified under parameter
swift_store_config_file. When this parameter is set to the same file
(glance-api.conf), we have lot of non-critical errors in glance-api
log, because of 'Invalid format of swift store config'.

The same problem, when we have RadosGW.

Change-Id: I18ee8f68f7ce793d2580685e79ed636556c57ddd
Related-bug: #1540890
(cherry picked from commit c8b7d3319b00fe6cc72f3963f5f618bc176d18b4)

subject: Enhancements to python-dracclient
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-30 17:35:28.000000000', 'files': ['dracclient/tests/test_client.py', 'dracclient/exceptions.py', 'dracclient/resources/memory.py', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/bios-setting-powerprofile.xml', 'dracclient/wsman.py', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/lifecycle-list-remote-services-ok.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/lifecycle-list-users-ok.xml', 'dracclient/utils.py', 'dracclient/resources/system.py', 'dracclient/client.py', 'dracclient/resources/raid.py', 'dracclient/resources/lifecycle_controller.py', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/virtual_disk_view-enum-ok.xml', 'dracclient/tests/utils.py', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/lifecycle-get-ilm-status-ok.xml', 'dracclient/resources/cpu.py', 'dracclient/tests/test_wsman.py', 'dracclient/resources/nic.py', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/nic-enumeration-enum-ok.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/lifecycle-admin-password-ok.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/mem-enumeration-enum-ok.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/bios-one-time-boot-ok.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/cpu-enumeration-enum-ok.xml', 'dracclient/resources/uris.py', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/system-info-enum-ok.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/system-led-invoke-ok.xml', 'dracclient/resources/bios.py'], 'message': "Enhancements to python-dracclient

Add cpu enumeration
    Provide information about the host's CPUs.

Add memory enumeration
    Provide information about the host's memory.

Add network interface enumeration
    Provide information about host's network interfaces.

Add system information enumeration
    Provide information about the host (versions, tags, etc).
    Enable and disable system ID LED (iDRAC version dependent).

Changes to BaseClientException class
    Extended to accept an optional list of exceptions messages.

Changes to DRACOperationFailed class
    Extended to allow exceptions mesages to be pushed up for handling.

Changes to WSManRequestFailure class
    Extended to allow exceptions mesages to be pushed up for handling.

Changes to BootManagement class
    Add one_time_boot method (HD or PXE).

Changes to BIOSAttribute class
    Add get_bios_setting method to retrieve a single bios setting via
    filter_query, reducing overhead of enumeration when only a single
    value is desired.

Changes to LifecycleControllerManagement class
    Add get_ilm_status method, returns the value of GetRSStatus.
    Add list_ilm_users method, returns a list of DRACUser objects.
    Add set_ilm_user_password method, sets the password for a given
    DRACUser object.
    Add list_remote_services method, returns a dictionary of avilable
    remote services as keys, and their current status as boolean.
    Add set_remote_services method, takes a dictionary of avialable
    remote services as keys, and their desired status as boolean.

Changes to RAIDManagement class
    Returns PhysicalDiskIDs as a list inside the VirtualDisk
    namedtuple.

Changes to resources/uris.py
    Minor cleanup for easier reading.

Changes to utils.py
    Add find_all=False to arg list, and pass to find_xml().
    If find_all is True, return a list of items if the number of items
    is greater than 1.

Changes to wsman.Client class
    in _do_request, catch and raise exceptions from the requests class
    up to WSManRequestFailure.  This can be useful in exposing low-level
    communications issues with the ILM.

Add test cases to support all new methods and changes

Change-Id: I96cce1f8b9fe32864c2fb6584ff85af0687ad0e7
"}]
commit_message:
Enhancements to python-dracclient

Add cpu enumeration
    Provide information about the host's CPUs.

Add memory enumeration
    Provide information about the host's memory.

Add network interface enumeration
    Provide information about host's network interfaces.

Add system information enumeration
    Provide information about the host (versions, tags, etc).
    Enable and disable system ID LED (iDRAC version dependent).

Changes to BaseClientException class
    Extended to accept an optional list of exceptions messages.

Changes to DRACOperationFailed class
    Extended to allow exceptions mesages to be pushed up for handling.

Changes to WSManRequestFailure class
    Extended to allow exceptions mesages to be pushed up for handling.

Changes to BootManagement class
    Add one_time_boot method (HD or PXE).

Changes to BIOSAttribute class
    Add get_bios_setting method to retrieve a single bios setting via
    filter_query, reducing overhead of enumeration when only a single
    value is desired.

Changes to LifecycleControllerManagement class
    Add get_ilm_status method, returns the value of GetRSStatus.
    Add list_ilm_users method, returns a list of DRACUser objects.
    Add set_ilm_user_password method, sets the password for a given
    DRACUser object.
    Add list_remote_services method, returns a dictionary of avilable
    remote services as keys, and their current status as boolean.
    Add set_remote_services method, takes a dictionary of avialable
    remote services as keys, and their desired status as boolean.

Changes to RAIDManagement class
    Returns PhysicalDiskIDs as a list inside the VirtualDisk
    namedtuple.

Changes to resources/uris.py
    Minor cleanup for easier reading.

Changes to utils.py
    Add find_all=False to arg list, and pass to find_xml().
    If find_all is True, return a list of items if the number of items
    is greater than 1.

Changes to wsman.Client class
    in _do_request, catch and raise exceptions from the requests class
    up to WSManRequestFailure.  This can be useful in exposing low-level
    communications issues with the ILM.

Add test cases to support all new methods and changes

Change-Id: I96cce1f8b9fe32864c2fb6584ff85af0687ad0e7
