commit_message:
Vagrant: Stop sharing the ~/devstack directory

Commit 9b7ecdd25d45d94c16d25c62b3a7bf39761ded94 introduced sharing of
both a local networking-ovn as well as a devstack diretory. Since
we're using different local.conf files for each of these directories,
lets instead not share devstack.

Change-Id: I91f57832cacec4b6e7139c45d2a7cb298a1bab29
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Extend root device hints to support device name

This patch is extending the root device hints to support the device name
as input.

It's important to note that for SATA, SCSI and IDE disk controllers
the name is not recommended to be used because the order in which the
device nodes are added in Linux is arbitrary, resulting in devices like
/dev/sda and /dev/sdb switching around at boot time. The documentation
was updated to inform operators about this problem.

Depends-On: I48d6456c75bbe6ddf16ac6561e5461ca51eb9c37
Change-Id: I564d68ab1c66505195745c34e16e829b45a00a75
Closes-Bug: #1526732

subject: set oslo.cache and dogpile to INFO
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 06:29:49.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/_options.py'], 'message': "set oslo.cache and dogpile to INFO

devstack now sets up memcached for keystone by default. keystone
also highly recommends the use of memcached in a real deployment.

unfortunately, both oslo.cache and dogpile are very chatty, let's
set their default log level to INFO instead of DEBUG in an
attempt to reduce noise and log pollution.

Change-Id: I532f3cbd22075dfabf09e852d01a67757fdc8afa
"}]
commit_message:
set oslo.cache and dogpile to INFO

devstack now sets up memcached for keystone by default. keystone
also highly recommends the use of memcached in a real deployment.

unfortunately, both oslo.cache and dogpile are very chatty, let's
set their default log level to INFO instead of DEBUG in an
attempt to reduce noise and log pollution.

Change-Id: I532f3cbd22075dfabf09e852d01a67757fdc8afa

commit_message:
Format UUID when possible

We previously store UUID with dashed, and now we store them as string.

This change adds dash to UUID like before but still store them as
string to be able to store non UUID as ID.

Change-Id: Ic4f97a1c330c36b30dcfa5818c09503967b3bc66

commit_message:
Removal of bandit.yaml

Newer versions of Bandit do not require a bandit.yaml. The copy
of bandit.yaml included here was identical to the default ignoring
some style differences. The future direction of Bandit is to have
no need for a separate yaml. Everything will be command line driven.

Change-Id: I9a31e478605ba07fd7602003566cbef2a12433f7

But this error occurs not only using agent_ssh driver, but also

commit_message:
Fix error message in devstack

When deploy by IPA on devstack, error message without SWIFT_ENABLE_TEMPURLS
is "SWIFT_ENABLE_TEMPURLS must be True to use agent_ssh driver in Ironic.".
But this error occurs not only using agent_ssh driver, but also
using agent_ipmitool.
This patch set fixes this error message to
"SWIFT_ENABLE_TEMPURLS must be True to use agent_* driver in Ironic.".

Change-Id: I21ce85d00485037d5c86dcd28aa1c95d6dc308b7

commit_message:
Clean up Image Registry form tag fields

This patch updates the tag fields on the Image Registry form so they
have labels and use the form-group class. It also updates the "Add"
buttons so just an icon is displayed. This will fix problems with
translated text making the button too wide.

Closes-Bug: #1501116

commit_message:
Document SERVICE_REGION_CHOICES setting

This adds doc for the new SERVICE_REGION_CHOICES setting that is used
by django_openstack_auth to show the region names to choose from on
the login page. This list replaces the available service regions as
defined in the service catalog so it should match or be a subset of
them.

Setting is used by d-o-a patch found here:
  https://review.openstack.org/116016

Partial-Bug: #1359774
Change-Id: I16745d9a38cbf6ae4b0ea12893cfea1f47f92fdd

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-17 20:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/tests.py', 'openstack_auth/user.py', 'openstack_auth/forms.py', 'openstack_auth/backend.py'], 'message': 'Allow user to select initial services region at login

This patch adds the ability for a user to select the initial
services region when logging in. The service regions displayed
depend on the SERVICE_REGION_CHOICES setting, which is a list
of service region names. If the setting is not provided then the
initial region is chosen the same way it is now, by using either the
most recently used region or selecting the region for the first
non-identity service endpoint.

The SERVICE_REGION_CHOICES setting also limits the choices available
to the user from the Domain-Project-Region drop-drown menu in the
header. Therefore using this setting means that the actual service
regions in the keystone service catalog are ignored. It is up to the
cloud administrator to make sure the regions that can be selected
are valid.

Partial-Bug: #1359774
Change-Id: Ied263cb9c3656c92730b77c5908de6d8ac3edef2
'}]
commit_message:
Allow user to select initial services region at login

This patch adds the ability for a user to select the initial
services region when logging in. The service regions displayed
depend on the SERVICE_REGION_CHOICES setting, which is a list
of service region names. If the setting is not provided then the
initial region is chosen the same way it is now, by using either the
most recently used region or selecting the region for the first
non-identity service endpoint.

The SERVICE_REGION_CHOICES setting also limits the choices available
to the user from the Domain-Project-Region drop-drown menu in the
header. Therefore using this setting means that the actual service
regions in the keystone service catalog are ignored. It is up to the
cloud administrator to make sure the regions that can be selected
are valid.

Partial-Bug: #1359774
Change-Id: Ied263cb9c3656c92730b77c5908de6d8ac3edef2

commit_message:
Added original_resource_id field into resource

When creating new resource, gnocchi will automatically change the
resource id if it's not in UUID format. This patch adds a new field
original_resource_id into resource to store the original id which the
user submitted in the resource post request.

Change-Id: I2577bddfec9846101fa6240cfbd1c0178ab8ced4
Partial-Bug: #1518338

firewall driver is called after update_port_filter call.

on the port.

is moved before the port update call, giving a chance to

'}]
commit_message:
Rule, member updates are missed with enhanced rpc

The procedure to update security group rules and members in
firewall driver is called after update_port_filter call.
Because of this, new rules and member updates are not applied
on the port.

With this change the call to update rules and members
is moved before the port update call, giving a chance to
firewall drivers to update their rule and member caches.

Closes Bug: 1511782

Change-Id: I457e17c34b86f861f6e15de7c3adcb3f2b79d14e

commit_message:
Correct project source guessing for OpenStack

The links to the project source in all the developer docs are
incorrect. The link for keystone is like

 http://git.openstack.org/cgit/p/openstack/keystone

when it should be

 http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone

See the link to "Project Source" on the left on
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/ for example.

Also, developers sometimes use a ".git" URL when they clone so
strip off the .git.

Change-Id: I8e7620119a169e3322d602ea633303cf9f941605

commit_message:
do not configure worker specific items in init

this further corrects some issues with coordination. the basic issue
is described in a bug i fixed a while ago[1]. basically everything
defined in init is sort shared by workers. if it's unique to a worker
it should not be defined in init.

the weird addition to stop() is to maintain bug1418793[2]

[1] I2ad05e2085c0c0f78653c6354d301d18b8dee121
[2] Ied2f086e1f50950b430095ae7ee89036fd4a89d9

Change-Id: I979fdcd350c9a3a0fb6c02e831f1a450133ef76a
Closes-Bug: #1533787

commit_message:
Call l23network init for interface config

l23network base class now has fixes for networkmanager
which was creating some issues with interface gateways.

Includes a workaround for disabling bonding kernel module
because it gets enabled automatically in l23network class
initialization. (details in LP#1541028)

Change-Id: Ib50c2d3672f7e10cff5cc3c29d7b3dbf5d428a86
Closes-Bug: #1538757
(cherry picked from commit fba0825d97e3d192dea4209c25baab0a28587369)

commit_message:
Use pip_install_gr for os-testr

Use `pip_install_gr` instead of `pip_install -U` when installing
os-testr. This is the same approach that have just been approved in
the stable/kilo branch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274533/).

This is an improved way to install depencencies that do not conflict
with other ones defined in the global requirements repository.

Change-Id: Iab4298b148ca68091e5201a2c24ecbbf4cefa63f

subject: Remove 'date' from Object resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 19:42:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/object_store/v1/test_obj.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/obj.py'], 'message': "Remove 'date' from Object resource

While creating the various type formatters for properties, I created one
for the timestamp format used on the Date prop that is included in the
headers of account, container, and object resources. However, that
property just duplicates that of the X-Timestamp prop. Since the format
of X-Timestamp is also used elsewhere, it doesn't make much sense to
both include the duplicated info in Date along with having a custom
formatter for it. This change removes Date entirely (it never existed on
account or container, but was about to be added in another change which
spurred its removal here).

Change-Id: Ia458f0d6cb4ba4f4500df97cd58c62afd6d5b05f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'date' from Object resource

While creating the various type formatters for properties, I created one
for the timestamp format used on the Date prop that is included in the
headers of account, container, and object resources. However, that
property just duplicates that of the X-Timestamp prop. Since the format
of X-Timestamp is also used elsewhere, it doesn't make much sense to
both include the duplicated info in Date along with having a custom
formatter for it. This change removes Date entirely (it never existed on
account or container, but was about to be added in another change which
spurred its removal here).

Change-Id: Ia458f0d6cb4ba4f4500df97cd58c62afd6d5b05f

commit_message:
Fixup test-requirements to avoid tarballs install

Installation from url path is not supported in requirements.txt
and test-requirements.txt. This is now enforced in the gate job
check-requirements that was recently added using [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271980/

Change-Id: If46a565701fab712aceb131f3cf47cc4b66cca3d
Closes-Bug: 1541143

commit_message:
Release oslo.messaging 4.1.0

The main change in this release is the new rabbit
driver based on Pika binding.

There were some stabilization fixes merged into
existing kombu-driver.

And there were also some significant changes in zmq
like HA support for redis-sentinel so on.

Change-Id: I378e33b7efed32df4dd59621f616db97a319127b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 09:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_dns', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_haproxy', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ocf-fuel-funcs', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_ntp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/files/limits.conf'], 'message': 'Apply PAM security limits by running daemons through su

Daemons launched from OCF scripts inherit default resource limits. It
could confuse users and cause resource allocation fail under heavy load.

We should run daemons requiring root privileges through su - root -c, so
limits from limits.conf would be enforced. To make it easier to
implement, a new wrapper "ocf_run_as_root" is implemented in
ocf-fuel-funcs.

Change-Id: Iea56e4d08a2c1f92500129210d79e4b1fe04e3fd
Closes-Bug: #1429553
(cherry picked from commit 65eca547606edceedc15d8fadfd1e5822ba9f1f6)
'}]
commit_message:
Apply PAM security limits by running daemons through su

Daemons launched from OCF scripts inherit default resource limits. It
could confuse users and cause resource allocation fail under heavy load.

We should run daemons requiring root privileges through su - root -c, so
limits from limits.conf would be enforced. To make it easier to
implement, a new wrapper "ocf_run_as_root" is implemented in
ocf-fuel-funcs.

Change-Id: Iea56e4d08a2c1f92500129210d79e4b1fe04e3fd
Closes-Bug: #1429553
(cherry picked from commit 65eca547606edceedc15d8fadfd1e5822ba9f1f6)

This fixes an issue where compute cannot be started until

commit_message:
Enable computes at end of deploy for VMWare

This fixes an issue where compute cannot be started until
ceilometer agent is ready, but needs to be ready for
vcenter_compute_zones_create task. nova-compute should only
be started during enable_compute task.

Ceilometer compute agent was renamed to ceilometer-polling
and simplifies ceilometer deployment.

Change-Id: I17389d21856159814d862022f09e6dd4fb5b80e4
Closes-Bug: #1537403

commit_message:
Basic VIP management handlers added to nailgun API

New VIP handlers is introduced that allows list VIP for cluster and get or update
specific VIP.

/clusters/:cluster_id/network_configuration/ips/vips
/clusters/:cluster_id/network_configuration/ips/:ip_address_id/vips

Partial-Bug: #1482399
Implements Blueprint: allow-any-vip
Change-Id: I4a4058c112bbdb26ab410e5e97b4e1e3afe7a082

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-02-01 17:18:12.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/service.py'], 'message': "Kill all greenlets of parent process

After os.fork parent process we may have a lot of not needed parent's
greenlets. After executing eventlet.hubs.use_hub() we will recreate
hub and will never call these greenlets but they are not stopped correctly
and some resources may be locked forever.

This patch raises exception for all greenlets and finsh them correctly

Change-Id: Icddf032f8bbc4588dc45207efcb5f243190e4fdb
"}]
commit_message:
Kill all greenlets of parent process

After os.fork parent process we may have a lot of not needed parent's
greenlets. After executing eventlet.hubs.use_hub() we will recreate
hub and will never call these greenlets but they are not stopped correctly
and some resources may be locked forever.

This patch raises exception for all greenlets and finsh them correctly

Change-Id: Icddf032f8bbc4588dc45207efcb5f243190e4fdb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-25 12:37:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': 'Enable X-Forwarded-Proto header for keystone_public

One of the ways to make use of TLS in keystone is through the usage of
the X-Fowarded-Proto header, which will be forwarded with the request
by the loadbalancer, and it will tell keystone what protocol was used
to access it. This also requires configuration from the keystone side.

Change-Id: I9b899ba95e28b7dfae0c1ed84ca8431054673925
(cherry picked from commit 846b4fe0b82f861c3f6c637cdc5d7d9f052e4338)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable X-Forwarded-Proto header for keystone_public

One of the ways to make use of TLS in keystone is through the usage of
the X-Fowarded-Proto header, which will be forwarded with the request
by the loadbalancer, and it will tell keystone what protocol was used
to access it. This also requires configuration from the keystone side.

Change-Id: I9b899ba95e28b7dfae0c1ed84ca8431054673925
(cherry picked from commit 846b4fe0b82f861c3f6c637cdc5d7d9f052e4338)

commit_message:
New VIP-related fields in the database

* Add 'is_user_defined' field to 'ip_addrs' table.
* Rename 'vip_type' field to 'vip_name' of table 'ip_addrs'.
* Add 'vip_namespace' field to 'ip_addrs' table.
* Copy vip namespaces from plugin table network roles to 'vip_namespace' field
  according to the unique vip name.
* Add database migrations.
* Add unit test for migrations.

Change-Id: Ia3e1d7f6e08dbebcb182de75eeaf58ddf6be4a8d
Partial-bug: #1482399

commit_message:
Call l23network init for interface config

l23network base class now has fixes for networkmanager
which was creating some issues with interface gateways.

Includes a workaround for disabling bonding kernel module
because it gets enabled automatically in l23network class
initialization. (details in LP#1541028)

Change-Id: Ib50c2d3672f7e10cff5cc3c29d7b3dbf5d428a86
Closes-Bug: #1538757

commit_message:
kilo: stack.sh error: grep: /opt/stack//requirements/global-requirements.txt: No such file or directory

stack.sh always stops by the following message.
[ERROR] /home/user/devstack/inc/python:142 Can't find package os-testr in requirements
To fix this issue, requirements should be put before installing os-testr.

Change-Id: I08a497f01d2114cb1b17dc4fca7e182366de1148
Closes-Bug: #1539748

subject: Cannot use pip_install_gr before install_infra
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 17:34:36.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Cannot use pip_install_gr before install_infra

The library os-testr cannot be installed using pip_install_gr (line
693). In fact the global-requirements.txt file is downloaded by the lib
infra, which is installed later in the file (line 715).

As done in master branch, it is possible to use `pip_install -U` instead
of `pip_install_gr`. I do not suggest to install infra before for
consistency with the other branches.

Change-Id: I632cb83fab264cde8edb5319b93809e11e4f2352
Closes-Bug: #1539748
'}]
commit_message:
Cannot use pip_install_gr before install_infra

The library os-testr cannot be installed using pip_install_gr (line
693). In fact the global-requirements.txt file is downloaded by the lib
infra, which is installed later in the file (line 715).

As done in master branch, it is possible to use `pip_install -U` instead
of `pip_install_gr`. I do not suggest to install infra before for
consistency with the other branches.

Change-Id: I632cb83fab264cde8edb5319b93809e11e4f2352
Closes-Bug: #1539748

commit_message:
Remove redundant tempest job for heatclient

Currently gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-heatclient does not
execute any Heat related tests, due to this job does not install Heat.
So it can be removed.

commit_message:
Added __init__.py to tests/services/identity/

This is necessary for the tests to actually be run.

Also use sort_keys=True for json.dumps() in both the auth() methods and the
unit tests that compare the expected and actual request bodies. Otherwise
the order of the keys is unpredictable and the tests fail randomly.

Change-Id: Ieb27be22367b419326939c4261388286e6c996c4

subject: Fix rsync service restart in os_swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 17:00:31.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_swift/handlers/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/tasks/swift_storage_hosts_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Fix rsync service restart in os_swift

The rsync service is currently restarted using two handlers, one to stop
the service and a second to start it. There is not a sufficient delay
between the two task and so the rsync pid has not been removed before
the attempt is made to start the service.

This commit replaces the two handlers with a single one that will do the
restart in one go.

Change-Id: I8ed4630da1add7205552b6ec731a143dbe45112b
Closes-bug: 1538649
(cherry picked from commit 5957af33553ef91d4b864a6173b258ef1dd338c8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rsync service restart in os_swift

The rsync service is currently restarted using two handlers, one to stop
the service and a second to start it. There is not a sufficient delay
between the two task and so the rsync pid has not been removed before
the attempt is made to start the service.

This commit replaces the two handlers with a single one that will do the
restart in one go.

Change-Id: I8ed4630da1add7205552b6ec731a143dbe45112b
Closes-bug: 1538649
(cherry picked from commit 5957af33553ef91d4b864a6173b258ef1dd338c8)

The _cleanup_allocated_network method used in nova.compute.manager.py
has exception handling around deallocate_for_instance.  That should
be added in nova.condutor.manager as well. Without it we'll end up
with the RPC layer complaining about unexpected exceptions.

This commit add exception handling logic around deallocate_for_instance

commit_message:
Add exception handling in _cleanup_allocated_network

The _cleanup_allocated_network method used in nova.compute.manager.py
has exception handling around deallocate_for_instance.  That should
be added in nova.condutor.manager as well. Without it we'll end up
with the RPC layer complaining about unexpected exceptions.

This commit add exception handling logic around deallocate_for_instance
nova.conductor.manager._cleanup_allocated_network() method.

Change-Id: Id536e2b4794d56a32af4d13577415e427e2eeb2d

commit_message:
setup: build config file at build time

Do not generate it as sdist time as the sdist worker might not have the
latest version of the dependency (which contains option), so it's better
to do it at build time with the right installed dependency.

Change-Id: I239fc6ef3b6053f9d5bdd7ce1a2e1960dd3fef8f

The OpenStackClients class provides a convenient way to create and
cache client instances.  The idea behind this code comes from Magnum
[0].

The OpenStackClients class will act as the manager of other project's
clients, providing an easy way to fetch instances of said clients. This
will allow the clients to be cached.

An instance of OpenStackClients is created for every call that comes
into the decision engine and the applier, using the request context to
pass needed (domain id) parameters to get a Keystone session.  This
instance should be shared as much as possible to avoid additional
unneccessary connections to the other services.

This class will also allow for the version of each client to be
configurable via the watcher.conf file.

The method by which a Keystone session is also changed to use the
keystoneauth1.loading library.  In order to avoid DuplicateOptErrors
with the keystone_authtoken group used for the keystonemiddleware in the
API code, a new conf group named "watcher_clients_auth" is created.  A
typical configuration using a password authentication scheme will look
like:
  [watcher_clients_auth]
  auth_type = password
  auth_url = http://<server-ip>:<port>
  username = <username>
  password = <password>
  project_domain_id = default
  user_domain_id = default

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/common/clients.py

DocImpact
Change-Id: Iab9d0b304099686da2e9e2b19e8b1de4332ff378
Implements: blueprint external-api-versioning
Closes-Bug: #1530790
Closes-Bug: #1539670
Closes-Bug: #1522774
'}]
commit_message:
Create OpenStackClients convenience class

The OpenStackClients class provides a convenient way to create and
cache client instances.  The idea behind this code comes from Magnum
[0].

The OpenStackClients class will act as the manager of other project's
clients, providing an easy way to fetch instances of said clients. This
will allow the clients to be cached.

An instance of OpenStackClients is created for every call that comes
into the decision engine and the applier, using the request context to
pass needed (domain id) parameters to get a Keystone session.  This
instance should be shared as much as possible to avoid additional
unneccessary connections to the other services.

This class will also allow for the version of each client to be
configurable via the watcher.conf file.

The method by which a Keystone session is also changed to use the
keystoneauth1.loading library.  In order to avoid DuplicateOptErrors
with the keystone_authtoken group used for the keystonemiddleware in the
API code, a new conf group named "watcher_clients_auth" is created.  A
typical configuration using a password authentication scheme will look
like:
  [watcher_clients_auth]
  auth_type = password
  auth_url = http://<server-ip>:<port>
  username = <username>
  password = <password>
  project_domain_id = default
  user_domain_id = default

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/common/clients.py

DocImpact
Change-Id: Iab9d0b304099686da2e9e2b19e8b1de4332ff378
Implements: blueprint external-api-versioning
Closes-Bug: #1530790
Closes-Bug: #1539670
Closes-Bug: #1522774

commit_message:
Adding gerritbot and accessbot support for openstack-product

The openstack-product IRC channel will be used by the OpenStack Product
Working Group for additional conversations when the meetings take longer
than our allocated time on the openstack meeting channel.  The product
working group will also be in the channel so that we can answer any
questions related to our working group and/or user stories.

Change-Id: Id3779c5dbd750d3d34a2866d514170de12dea073

commit_message:
Implement basic Zaqar queue operations

Add actions to post, pop and get messages from a Zaqar queue. As the
Zaqar client is built differently from other OpenStack modules, the
usual generator logic doesn't apply, we need to re-implement them
directly in the action

blueprint mistral-zaqar-integration

Change-Id: Ib9cc39a0053ad7c117e2fba4b3b64a216190567f

commit_message:
Enable computes at end of deploy for VMWare

This fixes an issue where compute cannot be started until
ceilometer agent is ready, but needs to be ready for
vcenter_compute_zones_create task. nova-compute should only
be started during enable_compute task.

Ceilometer compute agent was renamed to ceilometer-polling
and simplifies ceilometer deployment.

Change-Id: I17389d21856159814d862022f09e6dd4fb5b80e4
Closes-Bug: #1537403

commit_message:
Systemd syslog settings for astute, nailgun and ostf

Replaced by: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/250397

Services astute, nailgun, ostf were converted to systemd units
in a set of requests:
* astute  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248128
* nailgun https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248206
* ostf    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248096

assassind, receiverd, statsenderd, oswl_* are a part of nailgun
so there is no separate request for them (included in 248206)

However, those commits add only service units.

This commit adds conf files with customized settings for those services.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: I8e90e920aa1961aae873a6c7f8bdc6fd34bbdea9

It appears the Cirros image doesn't have no_timer_check, which

commit_message:
Use Fedora image for ping test

It appears the Cirros image doesn't have no_timer_check, which
sometimes causes the image to hang on boot.  Let's use a fedora
image that we know does have no_timer_check.  This will cause the
test to take a little longer because it doesn't boot as fast as
Cirros, but that's way better than waiting two hours for a recheck.

I'm using the old f21 image because that's what we were using in
the past for instack CI, and it seemed to be reliable back then.
Once we've got this stabilized a bit we can look at moving to a
new fedora image (although for some reason the f21 image is quite
a bit smaller than more recent ones, so we might just want to keep
it).

Change-Id: Iaf2257a76a8214f165ff412574ea77ca5d07cb77
(cherry picked from commit aa46e8dff8c318bb6b314b0072a03fcafe6fd75e)

commit_message:
Use eval_generate instead of generate

Current override_resources implementation will not create
all needed dependencies/relationships (before, after, notify,
subscribe) for new resources (not defined in catalog).

This fix requires that override_resources MUST
be used ALWAYS as first resource in manifets.

We need to put that statement in documentation

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iac6541c6e7440cb9c4c87ee52cc178c548b19ad6
Closes-Bug: #1538526

commit_message:
Introduce new tests for backup-restore feature

We should check that real-world use case with complete reinstallation(or replacement)
of fuel master node do not break the feature and fuel.
Aslo this patch introduces new method that allow to reinstall fuel master node from scratch

(cherry picked from commit 09ab2dfd874b026d528c3f9aeea74d62620f9b54)

commit_message:
Adding SaltStack to OpenStack

Brings in SaltStack formulas for installing and operating complete OpenStack
cloud deployments. The main focus is to setup development, testing, and
production OpenStack deployments in easy, scalable and predictable way.

All code has been developed under an Apache 2.0 license and has no
restrictions on distribution or deployment. All openstack-salt code is
submitted and reviewed through OpenStack Gerrit [1]. The main project code
for documentation is being developed on Github [2]. The openstack-salt project
maintains a core team that approves all changes. Bugs are filed, reviewed
and tracked in Launchpad [3].

Openstack-salt integrates OpenStack projects and services into complete
testing and production deployments.

Formulas in the first release cover the core OpenStack services, supporting
OpenStack versions Juno, Kilo and Liberty. The formulas for supplemental
services like galera, rabbitmq, openssh, ntp, linux are available on GitHub
and will be added in the next OpenStack-salt release.

The first major release of openstack-salt will be tagged for Mitaka.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+openstack-salt,n,z
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-salt
[3]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-salt

Change-Id: Ib498f3a970c79796c258d866ae6787494d39febf

subject: add new Repo(shovel) to the Governance Repository
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-23 19:17:33.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "add new Repo(shovel) to the Governance Repository

- Shovel(https://github.com/keedya/shovel) is an open source project,
  coordinates between Openstack (Ironic, glance) and rackHD  allowing
  users to find Baremetal Compute nodes dynamically discovered by RackHD
  and register them with Ironic and provides poller service that monitors
  compute nodes and logs the errors from SEL into Ironic Database.
  Eslint and eslint-config-openstack is implemented in shovel(npm run lint)
  along with unit tests that covers >80%(npm run test).
  Shovel releases registered in npm under node-shovel
  (https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-shovel#licensing)
- Consistent Testing Interface: shovel is written in nodejs,
  openstackinfra provides support for
  nodejs: run install unit tests, lint, and publish to npm
- Dependency: shovel depends on rackHD for baremetal discovery and SEL pollers
- License: Apache License
- Project has one active contributor

Note:
- Shovel efforts also include a horizon plugin
 (https://github.com/keedya/shovel-horizon-plugin)
 and a python client package
 (https://github.com/keedya/shovel-api-python-client)
- the purpose of creating shovel was to create an Ironic driver
    that can work more closely with rackHD and enable new features that
    are different from Ironic's goals

Change-Id: Ib68ea6e27de6b0e81c6b315c1495156af22f19d4
"}]
commit_message:
add new Repo(shovel) to the Governance Repository

- Shovel(https://github.com/keedya/shovel) is an open source project,
  coordinates between Openstack (Ironic, glance) and rackHD  allowing
  users to find Baremetal Compute nodes dynamically discovered by RackHD
  and register them with Ironic and provides poller service that monitors
  compute nodes and logs the errors from SEL into Ironic Database.
  Eslint and eslint-config-openstack is implemented in shovel(npm run lint)
  along with unit tests that covers >80%(npm run test).
  Shovel releases registered in npm under node-shovel
  (https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-shovel#licensing)
- Consistent Testing Interface: shovel is written in nodejs,
  openstackinfra provides support for
  nodejs: run install unit tests, lint, and publish to npm
- Dependency: shovel depends on rackHD for baremetal discovery and SEL pollers
- License: Apache License
- Project has one active contributor

Note:
- Shovel efforts also include a horizon plugin
 (https://github.com/keedya/shovel-horizon-plugin)
 and a python client package
 (https://github.com/keedya/shovel-api-python-client)
- the purpose of creating shovel was to create an Ironic driver
    that can work more closely with rackHD and enable new features that
    are different from Ironic's goals

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 15:37:14.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_dns', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_haproxy', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ocf-fuel-funcs', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_ntp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/files/limits.conf'], 'message': 'Apply PAM security limits by running daemons through su

Daemons launched from OCF scripts inherit default resource limits. It
could confuse users and cause resource allocation fail under heavy load.

We should run daemons requiring root privileges through su - root -c, so
limits from limits.conf would be enforced. To make it easier to
implement, a new wrapper "ocf_run_as_root" is implemented in
ocf-fuel-funcs.

Change-Id: Iea56e4d08a2c1f92500129210d79e4b1fe04e3fd
Closes-Bug: #1429553
'}]
commit_message:
Apply PAM security limits by running daemons through su

Daemons launched from OCF scripts inherit default resource limits. It
could confuse users and cause resource allocation fail under heavy load.

We should run daemons requiring root privileges through su - root -c, so
limits from limits.conf would be enforced. To make it easier to
implement, a new wrapper "ocf_run_as_root" is implemented in
ocf-fuel-funcs.

Change-Id: Iea56e4d08a2c1f92500129210d79e4b1fe04e3fd
Closes-Bug: #1429553

OpenStack-Infra has requested that lint tests be pipelined into the 'linters'
tox target in order to make more efficient use of nodepool resources.

This patch:

- Ensures that a complete set of lints tests is available in individual
  tox targets.
- Adds a 'linters' target which executes all the other lints tests.
- Removes our own custom scripts which used to facilitate lint tests
  through the old script-based style.
- Updates documentation that relates to lint testing and does a fair bit
  of revision to the dev docs related to testing and gating.

Notes:
- The E005, E006 exceptions for the bashate check will be removed in subsequent
  patches along with fixes that resolve those errors.

Change-Id: I7e090f325e07012de208c45bce8a6a9d9e241289
"}]
commit_message:
Revise all lint tests and add consolidated 'linters' tox environment

OpenStack-Infra has requested that lint tests be pipelined into the 'linters'
tox target in order to make more efficient use of nodepool resources.

This patch:

- Ensures that a complete set of lints tests is available in individual
  tox targets.
- Adds a 'linters' target which executes all the other lints tests.
- Removes our own custom scripts which used to facilitate lint tests
  through the old script-based style.
- Updates documentation that relates to lint testing and does a fair bit
  of revision to the dev docs related to testing and gating.

Notes:
- The E005, E006 exceptions for the bashate check will be removed in subsequent
  patches along with fixes that resolve those errors.

Change-Id: I7e090f325e07012de208c45bce8a6a9d9e241289

commit_message:
Update puppet-ceilometer module to currnet Mitaka version

Puppet-ceilometer module doesn't containt any custom patches.
Its state is upstream state on 6 Jan.

Additional changes:

  * use identity and auth uri instead of old
    keystone protocol and host parameters

Update noop tests and sections for some parameters.

Partial-blueprint: puppet-mitaka-modules

Change-Id: I739c7a89950aea57da93cf37e31d4d20fe3bbd94

commit_message:
Use upstart for RadosGW instead of rc.d script

Upstart script restarts RadosGW in case of failure, therefore improves
durability.

Change-Id: I714bcab128a296b20e795eef630749ec342326a5
Closes-bug: #1527177

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed
to a meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Change-Id: I5d2c67fe17e853c02572b3e725ee973714635e3c
Closes-Bug:#1512207

commit_message:
[POC] Heka proof-of-concept tests

This change does not mean to be merged. I put it there for people
interested to see what I am doing.

I will also use another branch on GitHub with multiple commits. The
gerrit branch is just a "squashed into one commit" version of that
GitHub branch.

https://github.com/openstack/kolla/compare/master...elemoine:heka

Change-Id: Ib324310255d679431ebd046ad0731106a58851ac

To avoid this problem, this patch switches using volumes to backend
defines, which allow to pass volume_backend_name.

Because Puppet 3.x doesn't support to handle array, in this patch
was added custom define, which call upstream cinder classes, that

(cherry picked from commit a177b501b55bb5d19d8ecdd1167f7a76a06701d5)

commit_message:
Specify backend name for all Cinder backends

Currently for configuration cinder backends we are using volume classes,
and all of them have volume_backend_name 'DEFAULT'. It will lead to
problems, when we have multibackend for Cinder.

To avoid this problem, this patch switches using volumes to backend
defines, which allow to pass volume_backend_name.

Because Puppet 3.x doesn't support to handle array, in this patch
was added custom define, which call upstream cinder classes, that
create cinder types.

Change-Id: I24023b01e1472f82197aa5c4807cb2728c67d742
Closes-bug: #1536643
(cherry picked from commit a177b501b55bb5d19d8ecdd1167f7a76a06701d5)

subject: get-modulename: Handle no packages entry in setup.cfg
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-03 08:14:22.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/get-modulename.py'], 'message': "get-modulename: Handle no packages entry in setup.cfg

get-modulename.py is used in the translation jobs.
It assumed all setup.cfg has [files] packages entry,
but setup.cfg in some repos do not.
Let's use a project name as a module name in this case.

Change-Id: I134160b9910020a9be46efe17057977a845c8bb9
"}]
commit_message:
get-modulename: Handle no packages entry in setup.cfg

get-modulename.py is used in the translation jobs.
It assumed all setup.cfg has [files] packages entry,
but setup.cfg in some repos do not.
Let's use a project name as a module name in this case.

Change-Id: I134160b9910020a9be46efe17057977a845c8bb9

commit_message:
Update the method of backup-restore

During the process of backup restore, we should not set the state
of the volume to "error" if it is caused by other problems like
without expected backup status and backup service.

Change-Id: I0ebff6b55807a80759e9f20103dc4a894aa8af73

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-28 05:44:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'remove the wrong param of fake_db_migration initiation.

In test_get_migrations, fake_db_migration is initated with a
wrong param.

There is no uuid field in migration db.
It should be instance_uuid.

The test case does not verify this param.
If we remain it here, the developers may make wrong impression
on migration db struct.

This patch removes it.
So do not mislead the developers.

Change-Id: I35ce83a746391cdc19d26769841b0ae123e2c2be
'}]
commit_message:
remove the wrong param of fake_db_migration initiation.

In test_get_migrations, fake_db_migration is initated with a
wrong param.

There is no uuid field in migration db.
It should be instance_uuid.

The test case does not verify this param.
If we remain it here, the developers may make wrong impression
on migration db struct.

This patch removes it.
So do not mislead the developers.

Change-Id: I35ce83a746391cdc19d26769841b0ae123e2c2be

commit_message:
Make WebSSO trusted_dashboard hostname case-insensitive

Ensure the hostname in the trusted_dashboard config is lowercase
to prevent failures when comparing against the origin query URL.

Closes-Bug: #1538754
Change-Id: I807a567e7d93c09c5c370065509c106b7d1c973b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 04:47:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_service.py'], 'message': "Object: Give more helpful error message in TestServiceVersion

It is very helpful when we bump service rpc version since we have
test_version() case to cover that, but sometime we do rebase/bump
rpc service version we may forget to increae compute_manager's version,
in this case test_version give a wrong message will make `new` developer
confused, and spend time to do debuging, this patch improves the error
message.

Change-Id: I64320b5a46aa0543e3d9e8fdd27f6faa3829cf69
"}]
commit_message:
Object: Give more helpful error message in TestServiceVersion

It is very helpful when we bump service rpc version since we have
test_version() case to cover that, but sometime we do rebase/bump
rpc service version we may forget to increae compute_manager's version,
in this case test_version give a wrong message will make `new` developer
confused, and spend time to do debuging, this patch improves the error
message.

Change-Id: I64320b5a46aa0543e3d9e8fdd27f6faa3829cf69

subject: Remove unnecessary group of Tempest config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 07:39:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary group of Tempest config

Tempest refers CONF.identity-feature-enabled.api_extensions for
getting Keystone configuration from tempest.conf, but the commit
I3a92397d7bc62c3ec156281696d5c22504a86cb3 adds unnecessary group
identity and Tempest cannot refer the configuration now.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Id7e1a94b1078b5934d2d140e85594ac0010e2e73
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary group of Tempest config

Tempest refers CONF.identity-feature-enabled.api_extensions for
getting Keystone configuration from tempest.conf, but the commit
I3a92397d7bc62c3ec156281696d5c22504a86cb3 adds unnecessary group
identity and Tempest cannot refer the configuration now.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Id7e1a94b1078b5934d2d140e85594ac0010e2e73

commit_message:
Add unit test cases for cdh plugin utils

For some methods implemented in the base class but depends on
the versions, add tests in their own directory.

changes:
* add test cases base for plugin utils
* add test cases for cdh v5 plugin utils
* add test cases for cdh v530 plugin utils
* add test cases for cdh v540 plugin utils

partially implements bp: cdh-plugin-refactoring

Change-Id: If27fc0c51f66c596960eb031036cc411114f5b6f

subject: Use install instead of mkdir for DevStack dirs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-02 09:58:12.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/watcher'], 'message': 'Use install instead of mkdir for DevStack dirs

The current code will not work if WATCHER_CONF_DIR or
WATCHER_AUTH_CACHE_DIR already exist but are owned by a different user
such as root. Use install instead of mkdir to handle this scenario.

Change-Id: Ie582a4b393e898e007d73f31de490c4b77e40be3
Closes-Bug: #1539422
'}]
commit_message:
Use install instead of mkdir for DevStack dirs

The current code will not work if WATCHER_CONF_DIR or
WATCHER_AUTH_CACHE_DIR already exist but are owned by a different user
such as root. Use install instead of mkdir to handle this scenario.

Change-Id: Ie582a4b393e898e007d73f31de490c4b77e40be3
Closes-Bug: #1539422

commit_message:
Support xvfbwrapper 0.2.8

xvfbwrapper 0.2.8 renamed the xvfb_cmd attribute of xvfbwrapper.Xvfb
to extra_xvfb_args. This change checks if the new attribute name is
available to support new and old xvfbwrapper version.

xvfbwrapper commit changing the API:
https://github.com/cgoldberg/xvfbwrapper/commit/9a8c0e80f6a932d5448d1b97d5a9c316a7a7c8e3

Closes-Bug: #1540495
Change-Id: I45704450ff396787453937362029945b94887189

commit_message:
LeftHand: Implement v2 replication (unmanaged)

This patch implements the unmanaged side of v2 replication in the HPE
LeftHand driver.

With unmanaged replication, the original driver instance will handle
all provisioning requests even after a failover.

cinder.conf should have the replication config group:

[lefthandrep]
hpelefthand_api_url = https://10.10.10.10:8081/lhos
hpelefthand_username = user
hpelefthand_password = pass
hpelefthand_clustername = vsa-12-5-mgmt1-vip
volume_backend_name = lefthandrep
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.hpe.hpe_lefthand_iscsi.\
                HPELeftHandISCSIDriver
replication_device = target_device_id:lh-id,
                     hpelefthand_api_url:https://11.11.11.11:8081/lhos,
                     hpelefthand_username:user2,
                     hpelefthand_password:pass2,
                     hpelefthand_clustername:vsa-12-5-mgmt2-vip

Change-Id: I3c489e986648eee16b3bf5a19799a4ea0c0240b0
Implements: blueprint hp-lefthand-v2-replication
DocImpact

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14605, 'name': 'vikram.choudhary', 'email': 'vikschw@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikram.choudhary'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-29 09:15:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'neutron/policy.py'], 'message': 'Raise RetryRequest on policy parent not found

During a port list operation, a port and its parent network
may be concurrently deleted from the database after they have
been retrieved from the DB but before policy is enforced.
Then when the policy engine tries to do a get_network to check
network ownership for a port on a network that no longer exists,
it will encounter a NetworkNotFound exception from the core plugin.

This exception was being propagated all of the way up to the whole
API operation as a 404, which made no sense in the context of a
port list.

This patch adjusts the logic to catch any NotFound exceptions during
this processing and convert them into a RetryRequest to trigger the
API to restart the operation. At this point the objects will be gone
from the database so the problematic items will not be passed to the
policy engine for enforcement.

Closes-Bug: #1528031
Change-Id: I89d12fe0767e1c7ecb68138b5f6f17aa68a68769
(cherry picked from commit 77de9653fd60a802b11f157972f7b3e81497e8a7)
'}]
commit_message:
Raise RetryRequest on policy parent not found

During a port list operation, a port and its parent network
may be concurrently deleted from the database after they have
been retrieved from the DB but before policy is enforced.
Then when the policy engine tries to do a get_network to check
network ownership for a port on a network that no longer exists,
it will encounter a NetworkNotFound exception from the core plugin.

This exception was being propagated all of the way up to the whole
API operation as a 404, which made no sense in the context of a
port list.

This patch adjusts the logic to catch any NotFound exceptions during
this processing and convert them into a RetryRequest to trigger the
API to restart the operation. At this point the objects will be gone
from the database so the problematic items will not be passed to the
policy engine for enforcement.

Closes-Bug: #1528031
Change-Id: I89d12fe0767e1c7ecb68138b5f6f17aa68a68769
(cherry picked from commit 77de9653fd60a802b11f157972f7b3e81497e8a7)

subject: Update the HA section of the FAQ.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-02 17:06:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/faq.rst'], 'message': 'Update the HA section of the FAQ.

I realized that there were some important cavets in the HA approach of
letting Neutron rebuild the OVN northbound database on failure.  While
trying to document the caveats, I came to the conclusion that this is
not currently a practical enough approach to document.  If we improve
things, we can add it back to the document.

Change-Id: Ib5449661792d95fd72783f963ce8d32dfdf316c2
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update the HA section of the FAQ.

I realized that there were some important cavets in the HA approach of
letting Neutron rebuild the OVN northbound database on failure.  While
trying to document the caveats, I came to the conclusion that this is
not currently a practical enough approach to document.  If we improve
things, we can add it back to the document.

Change-Id: Ib5449661792d95fd72783f963ce8d32dfdf316c2
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places. This updates
those one to use the non-deprecated LOG.warning instead.

Change-Id: I71d330e6a0f7c464358569b37f662e60b2f6450d
Closes-Bug: 1508442

commit_message:
Amphora Create now fails when amphora goes into ERROR status

Removed the retry flow and added retry logic to the task.  Upon
the ampora status returning "ERROR", the ComputeWaitTimeoutException
is raised and the flow reverts.  Also updated the failover amphora
flow to the same logic.

Change-Id: I74353bfebd14ce3d1aacdf5dd94152a019e932da
Closes-Bug: #1494931
Closes-Bug: #1490180

commit_message:
Don't update the name of keystone resources if name don't change

If the names of keystone resource no change when updating, 
do not to update them.

Change-Id: I4ec6497fdd6859a0fc106538bbad4d299c66a26e
Closes-Bug: #1522330

subject: skip test_list_server_filters_by_regex
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 22:03:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_list_server_filters.py'], 'message': "skip test_list_server_filters_by_regex

The test for the regex only works if we are always allocating linearly
from the bottom of the network block or on a small network
block. We're changing the IP allocator in Nova to be more resiliant,
and this test can be proven to be trivially wrong in that case.

It should be skipped until it can be fixed.

Change-Id: I27f73c1edf12218818c4d279efbd9fef5cdef672
Related-Bug: #1540645
"}]
commit_message:
skip test_list_server_filters_by_regex

The test for the regex only works if we are always allocating linearly
from the bottom of the network block or on a small network
block. We're changing the IP allocator in Nova to be more resiliant,
and this test can be proven to be trivially wrong in that case.

It should be skipped until it can be fixed.

Change-Id: I27f73c1edf12218818c4d279efbd9fef5cdef672
Related-Bug: #1540645

The entire mechanism for ssh validation is a mess. The fact that there
is a parameter which is server_or_ip, so you never know if it's an

commit_message:
Consolidate the ssh code

The entire mechanism for ssh validation is a mess. The fact that there
is a parameter which is server_or_ip, so you never know if it's an
object or an address, and that every one of 7 layers need to handle
either case, makes doing any enhancements here for failure detection
impossible.

This change implements a get_server_ip method that gets the fixed or
floating IP address before passing it to the remote client.

Change-Id: I76d818bf9e1bd26b1e499464fc9213764afee279

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-28 17:32:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Remove unwanted call to _get_routers while arp update

_generate_arp_table_and_notify_agent in l3_dvr_db.py calls
_get_router to get the router_dict to verify if it is a dvr
router or not.

But it does not need to validate it, since the ports were
obtained by filtering based on the DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE.

So it should have returned the ports only owned by the DVR
routers, and there is no need to re-validate if distributed
router or not.

This check is redundant and can be removed.

Change-Id: I74a7d966cfab1026eba836d9756ab1e385195919
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Remove unwanted call to _get_routers while arp update

_generate_arp_table_and_notify_agent in l3_dvr_db.py calls
_get_router to get the router_dict to verify if it is a dvr
router or not.

But it does not need to validate it, since the ports were
obtained by filtering based on the DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE.

So it should have returned the ports only owned by the DVR
routers, and there is no need to re-validate if distributed
router or not.

This check is redundant and can be removed.

Change-Id: I74a7d966cfab1026eba836d9756ab1e385195919

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-27 16:42:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/default-local-dns-a1c3fa1451f228fa.yaml', 'neutron/agent/dhcp/config.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': "Set default value for dnsmasq_local_resolv to False

patch 0de1d8d4c introduced a new behavior whereby dnsmasq can rely
on dns resolvers defined in the host's resolv.conf, and it did
that by default.

However this may introduce dns timeouts if the dns servers
are not reachable for whatever reason. This may be especially
likely in certain gate configurations (where the VM under test
is a guest itself).

Regardless of the root-cause analysis, this option should have
defaulted to False to preserve backward compatibility, therefore
this patch restores the old behavior in a way that local DNS
resolution occurs only if the new option variable is set to
True, or the admin has not explicitly set the list of DNS
servers to be injected in the DHCP response.

DocImpact: document how to configure DNS resolution by dnsmasq

Change-Id: I90ab26bfa83c2d23c92110b8da73ef771e11f7bb
"}]
commit_message:
Set default value for dnsmasq_local_resolv to False

patch 0de1d8d4c introduced a new behavior whereby dnsmasq can rely
on dns resolvers defined in the host's resolv.conf, and it did
that by default.

However this may introduce dns timeouts if the dns servers
are not reachable for whatever reason. This may be especially
likely in certain gate configurations (where the VM under test
is a guest itself).

Regardless of the root-cause analysis, this option should have
defaulted to False to preserve backward compatibility, therefore
this patch restores the old behavior in a way that local DNS
resolution occurs only if the new option variable is set to
True, or the admin has not explicitly set the list of DNS
servers to be injected in the DHCP response.

DocImpact: document how to configure DNS resolution by dnsmasq

Change-Id: I90ab26bfa83c2d23c92110b8da73ef771e11f7bb

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-31 05:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/model/migration/commands.py'], 'message': 'Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method. See:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning, so we

Change-Id: If714af9fe0c5577e19be38dc6cbf1f1f76db4db4
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method. See:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning, so we
prefer to use warning instead.

Change-Id: If714af9fe0c5577e19be38dc6cbf1f1f76db4db4

commit_message:
DVR: avoid race on dvr serviceable port deletion

Please see race details in the bug report.
The fix is to check for dvr routers that needs to be removed
after actual port deletion.
As a bonus we can get rid of dvr logic in ml2 plugin delete_port().

It's hard to come up with a test here as race can only be
reproduced with multiple API workers.

Closes-Bug: #1538163
Change-Id: I7ab1b0c18e5daa6f35a37370b9be79e689e2ba50

all of the details about extensions, adds a note about the deprecation
of extensions, and points to documentation about microversions for
discovering API changes.

Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: add a new live_migration_tunnelled config

Add a config option which explicitly controls whether we pass the
VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED flag to libvirt. This is a lot more covenient
than having users modify a list of obscure flags.

Note that this especially makes sense as part of a longer term plan
to remove the live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag config
options completely, and instead have config options for controlling
specific behavior choices that operators care about.

Note also that review Id8b38b0978cdc80df37cb26bb69d8f4bec5bf766
essentially proposes changing the default of this config value
to false.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I8d77596860a7803f8549cde4277e9a0509e4675a
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 13:07:44.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/artifacts/test_artifacts.py'], 'message': "Change exception format checks in artifact tests

Some tests for glance artifacts make some assumptions about
exception format from WebOp library. That can cause issues if
exception format is changed (we faced with that here
https://github.com/Pylons/webob/pull/230). So we need just check
if some info is present in exception message and don't make any
assumptions about exception format.

Change-Id: I284842de7786ab18bc892aa27fd7985896d4f4de
"}]
commit_message:
Change exception format checks in artifact tests

Some tests for glance artifacts make some assumptions about
exception format from WebOp library. That can cause issues if
exception format is changed (we faced with that here
https://github.com/Pylons/webob/pull/230). So we need just check
if some info is present in exception message and don't make any
assumptions about exception format.

Change-Id: I284842de7786ab18bc892aa27fd7985896d4f4de

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-29 06:01:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fix an convered exception in router AFTER_XXX callback

Testcase _test_process_routers_update_router_deleted directly tests the
update process. It lacks of router creating process so remove_router be
called but add_router never be called. That will trigger a TypeError
exception in remove_router callback function as it get a router NONE
from l3_agent.pd.routers

Closes-bug: 1539333
Change-Id: I366235fdd7e95dacc45039317a069953808d05b9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix an convered exception in router AFTER_XXX callback

Testcase _test_process_routers_update_router_deleted directly tests the
update process. It lacks of router creating process so remove_router be
called but add_router never be called. That will trigger a TypeError
exception in remove_router callback function as it get a router NONE
from l3_agent.pd.routers

Closes-bug: 1539333
Change-Id: I366235fdd7e95dacc45039317a069953808d05b9

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places. This updates
those one to use the non-deprecated LOG.warning instead.

Change-Id: I93184720f994f064f4c507aafceb6fb669fc4b8b
Closes-Bug: 1508442

The sample web server, using nc, currently does not close the

commit_message:
Make sample web server close connections

The sample web server, using nc, currently does not close the
connection after serving the content.  This can cause clients to
hang waiting for the connection to close after the content has been
served.  This patch includes the content length in the response
so that the connection will close.

Change-Id: I9443157f1edd8ed7e90599df73f5a48f16c955f1

commit_message:
Use Swift venv Python interpreter

The use of activate_this to access the venv libraries means that the
system site packages are also included when the scripts swift_rings.py
and swift_rings_check.py are run.

This commit updates the interpreter directive for those scripts, when
Swift is deployed in a venv, to use the venv's interpreter.

Change-Id: I3ff0bf60c9ca695cddc28b05a8e8cc67d5f240e5
Closes-bug: 1538993
(cherry picked from commit a82e4821fda5823541ba83c624f67699559a25bf)

For users of this code that wish to add on new

commit_message:
Allow msgpack extension registry to be copied

For users of this code that wish to add on new
type handlers it is really nice to be able to build
those ontop of the existing ones that the default
registry builds so to enable this provide a copy
method that can return a new registry based off
the current one (and it can unfreeze the new copy
so that it can be added to).

Change-Id: I5b2ba628208ce17302c165eae81c8ffff5de002a

commit_message:
Validate that all the containers are started

Container maybe exit after deployed. But the print_failure
never runs if the kolla-ansible run success.
This PS checks all the containers status after deploy and
failed the test if the container status is exited

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ia461b280855eda500e143ee1d6cfd5f215eaf6fe

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 11685, 'name': 'Stephen Balukoff', 'email': 'stephen@balukoff.com', 'username': 'sbalukoff'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17419, 'name': 'Banashankar k', 'email': 'banveerad@gmail.com', 'username': 'banveerad'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-01 21:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/common/config.py', 'elements/no-resolvconf/README.rst', 'diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'elements/no-resolvconf/finalise.d/99-disable-resolv-conf'], 'message': "Optimizations for tempest tests

This patch does the following:

* Reduces interval between checks when waiting on
  amphora status in a devstack environment. At the same time we
  increase the number of retries so we are effectively waiting
  the same total time before a timeout error occurs.
* Disables DNS resolution on the amphora image. Amphorae don't
  need to do any DNS resolution anyway since any outbound
  connections are done specifying IP addresses. This means
  that the amphora never waits for DNS timeouts to occur
  when booting and performing other tasks when operating in an
  environment where DNS resolution doesn't work (ie. devstack)

In preliminary tests, the above optimizations seem to shave
about 50-55 seconds off per test. (This is mostly due to the
elimination of DNS timeouts.)

Change-Id: Icc7d8e0ac18a4a18ed9eb0950081ddd198cf4684
"}]
commit_message:
Optimizations for tempest tests

This patch does the following:

* Reduces interval between checks when waiting on
  amphora status in a devstack environment. At the same time we
  increase the number of retries so we are effectively waiting
  the same total time before a timeout error occurs.
* Disables DNS resolution on the amphora image. Amphorae don't
  need to do any DNS resolution anyway since any outbound
  connections are done specifying IP addresses. This means
  that the amphora never waits for DNS timeouts to occur
  when booting and performing other tasks when operating in an
  environment where DNS resolution doesn't work (ie. devstack)

In preliminary tests, the above optimizations seem to shave
about 50-55 seconds off per test. (This is mostly due to the
elimination of DNS timeouts.)

Change-Id: Icc7d8e0ac18a4a18ed9eb0950081ddd198cf4684

commit_message:
Correctly parse csv even with extra output.

This patch ensure that the csv output is cleaned up from extra warning
message from the cli.

This has been addressed first here[1], then there[2] which had to be
reverted there[3].  So here again a fix.

Closes-bug: #1508511

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/237610/3
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238156/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262809/

Change-Id: I3a2e677c2bd349322cfb08d5dc73c1ced38c3f60

commit_message:
Convert neutronclient to use session

Communication with neutron is limited to the v2 API and uses the
auth_token middleware user by default. This user information should be
considered private.

Use the keystoneclient auth plugin loading functions to load any auth
plugin from the config file. This will allow us to support using v3
authentication.

Change-Id: Ifc492a9ae026c6d3ecc01296b55123319d781919

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-04 17:33:12.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/model/repositories.py', 'barbican/api/app.py'], 'message': "Addressing error by clearing sqlalchemy session leak

Barbican db logic leverages pool_recycle setting to handle case when mysql
server closes connection  after waiting for activity for certain amount of
time. This setting is identified via wait_timeout and interactive_timeout
variable on mysqld (server) configuration.

As long as connection pool's pool_recycle time is lesser than above timeout
values, this error should not happen assuming all sessions are properly
cleaned up after use.

Identified couple of places where the sessions were initialized but they were
not cleaned up. Addressing them fixes the issue in my local testing.

Change-Id: Id0f7d80f8244a40083053b9f6d5d1813f7b9bf44
Closes-Bug: #1527003
"}]
commit_message:
Addressing error by clearing sqlalchemy session leak

Barbican db logic leverages pool_recycle setting to handle case when mysql
server closes connection  after waiting for activity for certain amount of
time. This setting is identified via wait_timeout and interactive_timeout
variable on mysqld (server) configuration.

As long as connection pool's pool_recycle time is lesser than above timeout
values, this error should not happen assuming all sessions are properly
cleaned up after use.

Identified couple of places where the sessions were initialized but they were
not cleaned up. Addressing them fixes the issue in my local testing.

Change-Id: Id0f7d80f8244a40083053b9f6d5d1813f7b9bf44
Closes-Bug: #1527003

commit_message:
Add decorator option to disallow duplicate tracing

This adds a new decorator kwarg that will check if the
function to decorate has already been decorated, we can
later use this in trace_cls to at least attempt to not
re-decorate previously decorated methods.

Partial-Bug: 1537944

Change-Id: Icc0689689f258b56788d784a2080e1b101b6d461

Add OpenStack Newton release to spec repo

This adds the OpenStack newton release to the spec repo. It also
provides additional intro information to the index.rst so that
people will understand (without clicking through) that not all
searchlight features require specs.

Change-Id: I1d3c2f08ac16b75178d5b40291ef769966139ba0

Add:

To stack.sh to provide additional debug info. This will show the

commit_message:
Set PS4 in stack.sh to provide additional debug info

Add:
export PS4='+(${BASH_SOURCE}:${LINENO}): ${FUNCNAME[0]:+${FUNCNAME[0]}(): }'

To stack.sh to provide additional debug info. This will show the
filename, line number, function name, and the content of the line.

An example output line:
+++(/opt/stack/old/devstack/functions-common:675): get_field(): local data field

Info on this PS4 variable found at:
http://wiki.bash-hackers.org/scripting/debuggingtips

Change-Id: I272df6c79f6ff7afa8f102da24706558d9169eda

commit_message:
Fixes intermittend udp heartbeat test failure

The test assumes that an asynchronous task finishes in time
to trigger a mock. This is not always the case so I acdded
code to shutdown the executor which waits until all concurrent
tasks are finished.

Change-Id: Iafadbc3f661431b0acb2390a575d1fb217b9aaa8
Closes-Bug: #1539439

commit_message:
Test translation imports

Test imported files whether those are valid (can be compiled by
gettext) and do not propose them if they are invalid.

If there are invalid files, a proposal of valid files will still happen.
The script will fail at the end so that these invalid files can be
detected.

Change-Id: Ia48181bc79903dd47be054a6f7c7ee535506d282

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-02 17:54:29.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/services/executions.py', 'mistral/workflow/states.py', 'mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/execution.py', 'mistral/workflow/with_items.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_with_items.py', 'mistral/engine/default_engine.py'], 'message': 'Fix with-items concurrency for sub-workflows

For with-items task that uses concurrency to execute subworkflows, the
remaining iterations after the first iteration will return the same item
on subworkflow completion. This bug does not affect with-items task that
executes action.

The bug is caused by a delay in the scheduling of workflow execution and
the creation of the execution record. For action execution, the record is
created within the same DB transaction prior to scheduling.

This patch creates the workflow execution record first just like for
action execution and then schedule a resume workflow.

Change-Id: Iba80068260caead9ae8f2f8f105abc5b9349db52
Closes-Bug: #1536415
'}]
commit_message:
Fix with-items concurrency for sub-workflows

For with-items task that uses concurrency to execute subworkflows, the
remaining iterations after the first iteration will return the same item
on subworkflow completion. This bug does not affect with-items task that
executes action.

The bug is caused by a delay in the scheduling of workflow execution and
the creation of the execution record. For action execution, the record is
created within the same DB transaction prior to scheduling.

This patch creates the workflow execution record first just like for
action execution and then schedule a resume workflow.

Change-Id: Iba80068260caead9ae8f2f8f105abc5b9349db52
Closes-Bug: #1536415

The InvalidParameterValue exception does not define a meaningful
msg_fmt.  It is currently _("%(err)s"), which is the equivalent of

Replace InvalidParameterValue with Invalid exceptions.

Closes-Bug: #1538398
'}]
commit_message:
Remove InvalidParameterValue exception

The InvalidParameterValue exception does not define a meaningful
msg_fmt.  It is currently _("%(err)s"), which is the equivalent of
nothing and does not help with translation.

Replace InvalidParameterValue with Invalid exceptions.

Change-Id: If8b064e446cbc97e380127f360f262be9e8877a1
Closes-Bug: #1538398

commit_message:
remove "redhat-rpm-config" (F21 dependency)

Commit d5004a380294e05963d4de39007f3336e975fb0f introduced the package
"redhat-rpm-config" to make the Fedora 21 gate job running again.

As we dropped the F21 support in December 2015 with
commit 90bc5867728aafb66b374ae6e6a93318303dcff0 we don't need
this package anymore.

Change-Id: I71b969b7fd6651082451f6c4fd1e01d205771a11

commit_message:
Validates baymodel volume_driver patch requests

Instead of allowing any volume_driver value to be accepted by the
baymodel API. When updating baymodel, the patch can limit the
volume_driver value for the different coe.

Co-Authored By: Kai Qiang Wu(Kennan)<wkqwu@cn.ibm.com>
Co-Authored By: Ton Ngo<ton@us.ibm.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-integrate-with-cinder

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-14 16:27:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'releasenotes/notes/libvirt-live-migration-flags-mangling-a2407a31ddf17427.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: force config related migration flags

The Nova libvirt driver relies on libvirt deleting the configuration
from the source host at the end of the migration, otherwise the
VM remains on the source host in a "shut off" state ... except in
the case of block migration, where the cleanup code path does actually
delete the VM's libvirt config.

If the Nova code assume's that VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE is set,
there's really no sense in allowing users to configure without it.

Similarly, the driver explicitly saves the VM configuration on the
destination host, so it makes no sense to allow users to configure
the VIR_MIGRATE_PERSIST_DEST flag.

Change-Id: Ibeb35590fd83f2190c9c9cb16128e9e2628b38cd
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: force config related migration flags

The Nova libvirt driver relies on libvirt deleting the configuration
from the source host at the end of the migration, otherwise the
VM remains on the source host in a "shut off" state ... except in
the case of block migration, where the cleanup code path does actually
delete the VM's libvirt config.

If the Nova code assume's that VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE is set,
there's really no sense in allowing users to configure without it.

Similarly, the driver explicitly saves the VM configuration on the
destination host, so it makes no sense to allow users to configure
the VIR_MIGRATE_PERSIST_DEST flag.

Change-Id: Ibeb35590fd83f2190c9c9cb16128e9e2628b38cd
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-17 19:36:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Add a workaround to short circuit flavor migration code

When large operators are done running their flavor migrations, we're
still doing some things on each instance load to be compatible with
data in the old format. Since this is extra work, this adds a workarounds
flag to disable this behavior once the operator is *sure* that it's been
completed. This compatibility code was only in Kilo, so we only need this
tweak there.

Operators that enable this should be *extra* careful before enabling this
that all the flavor migrations (details in the release notes) have been
completed. The first DB migration in Liberty enforces that this is true,
and thus is a good way to provably demonstrate that a database is clean
enough to support enabling this.

Further, if you're not suffering from high conductor CPU load specific
to Kilo flavor migrations, you should not enable this as it's far less
tested than the main path. Since this migration is gone in Liberty, it'd
be far better to roll forward, if possible.

Change-Id: I49a9f5dfe75083945204d5f4d40daf3fbc626428
"}]
commit_message:
Add a workaround to short circuit flavor migration code

When large operators are done running their flavor migrations, we're
still doing some things on each instance load to be compatible with
data in the old format. Since this is extra work, this adds a workarounds
flag to disable this behavior once the operator is *sure* that it's been
completed. This compatibility code was only in Kilo, so we only need this
tweak there.

Operators that enable this should be *extra* careful before enabling this
that all the flavor migrations (details in the release notes) have been
completed. The first DB migration in Liberty enforces that this is true,
and thus is a good way to provably demonstrate that a database is clean
enough to support enabling this.

Further, if you're not suffering from high conductor CPU load specific
to Kilo flavor migrations, you should not enable this as it's far less
tested than the main path. Since this migration is gone in Liberty, it'd
be far better to roll forward, if possible.

Change-Id: I49a9f5dfe75083945204d5f4d40daf3fbc626428

subject: Neutron parses the wrong json revert to shell/csv.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 15:41:49.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/neutron_router/neutron_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Neutron parses the wrong json revert to shell/csv.

The neutron network provider is parsing the wrong json format leading
to an error when you're unlucky. Affected providers:
 - neutron_port
 - neutron_subnet
 - neutron_router
 - neutron_network

The neutron provider parses the json of the cliff-tablib's output while
the official one is the cliff' output[1].

As discussed in the ML[2] this patch implements a simple revert of the
json change.

Revert "Use json output instead plain-text"

This reverts commit 79f0e636c07b80b2c6699d934b42641bfef4352b[3]
 and part of commit 791a0f146b28544ec3d70c0ab2a950c4d5ca9f98[4]

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+bug/1529914
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/083172.html
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238156/

Change-Id: I93263256eb9d83544910ca4055bb3e9a463645e3
Closes-bug: 1530163
(cherry picked from commit 273ef1b228fbcb73edf021fabbf77ff5054e7dd7)
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron parses the wrong json revert to shell/csv.

The neutron network provider is parsing the wrong json format leading
to an error when you're unlucky. Affected providers:
 - neutron_port
 - neutron_subnet
 - neutron_router
 - neutron_network

The neutron provider parses the json of the cliff-tablib's output while
the official one is the cliff' output[1].

As discussed in the ML[2] this patch implements a simple revert of the
json change.

Revert "Use json output instead plain-text"

This reverts commit 79f0e636c07b80b2c6699d934b42641bfef4352b[3]
 and part of commit 791a0f146b28544ec3d70c0ab2a950c4d5ca9f98[4]

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+bug/1529914
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/083172.html
[3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238156/
[4]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/261418/

Change-Id: I93263256eb9d83544910ca4055bb3e9a463645e3
Closes-bug: 1530163
(cherry picked from commit 273ef1b228fbcb73edf021fabbf77ff5054e7dd7)
